Discord pulls ammo from thin air and can help when in lower activities to bypass reloading.
Masterworks: Reload Speed

There aren't a lot of hand cannons that see top tier usage in PvP. Opening Shot, Keep Away, and Perpetual Motion in one column, and Explosive Payload and Kill Clip in the other make for a stacked package. Add in enhanced perks and you have a recipe for a super solid hand cannon. Eye of the Storm or Fragile Focus would round out the mix for best perks on a hand cannon, but overall it's a solid choice. Hard to say if this is stronger than Palindrome and Exalted Truth, but it certainly holds its own. You'll have to fight some of the weird gun model though.
Masterworks: Stability

New Pacific Epitaph is our newest Stasis grenade launcher, at first I was disappointed with no Chill Clip, but then I saw why. A wave frame GL. This brings back up my excitement. Wave frame grenade launchers are arguably the best GL to bring into any content. They are easy to use, reliable, and unless the architecture messes with you very easy to secure multikills with. Collective Action is the best for subclass agnostic builds. Redirection will make easy work of bigger targets, and hordes building up that damage. Kill Clip is simple because you always have to reload to fire.
Masterworks: Velocity

In PvP there aren't many good perks here. Perpetual Motion is solid, but not a replacement for Auto-Loading Holster. Adrenaline Junkie can build up that damage for the highest damage but won't one shot a tier 10 guardian. Kill Clip and Harmony do less than Adrenaline Junkie 5x in that order
Masterworks: Velocity

I can see this submachine gun overtaking the CALUS Mini-Tool for those who like the aggressive frame family. I don't like one archetype over another for PvE but losing the enhanced perks and being unable to choose my direct perks almost feels like a loss now. It does open up a few different build capabilities with Demolitionist and Adrenaline Junkie for those grenade builds.
Masterworks: Stability

No Survivors is Immortal but energy. They feel similar, they both get Target Lock and Rangefinder. I would almost argue that No Survivors is better, but that might be because my vault has a lot of kinetic special weapons. It does open up loadouts which I love to see. No adept mods makes this SMG a little less high-end over something like Immortal, but does not get rid of its utility.
Masterworks: Stability

It's interesting to see the old Scathelocke model being used. I know many vets who loved this auto and I can't blame them. Reliable was the name of the game back in Vanilla. In today's world the best roll to look out for is similar to Rufus's Fury. The benefit Old Sterling has is in its frame. Being an adaptive frame might feel better to some users compared to Rufus;s Fury being a rapid-fire frame. Entirely dependent on how you like to shoot. Frenzy and Demolitionist I listed as being better perks only because Hatchling falls off incredibly quick on non-Strand builds. The extra damage from the Threadlings are nice, but don't pack as much of a punch without Strand to buff them.
Masterworks: Reload Speed

Adaptive autos have not been meta in quite a while. It was back when Hard Light was too strong that adaptive autos felt like they had a place. What a weird time to be playing Destiny. It was like a light show all the time in PvP. Nowadays you're going to have to do a lot to make adaptive autos feel strong. Surplus will bring up all your stats. Harmony when paired with a special weapon can also make multikills feel like a breeze if you couple the two. A fast handling, good feeling auto with a damage bump. Takes a lot to make this auto work, but I'm sure someone wants to.
Masterworks: Stability

Outlast is a great gun with awful stats. Arrowhead Brake is almost mandatory for bringing up the low recoil direction, but you might also want to throw on a CB mod for 100 recoil direction. Flared Magwell would be good for the stat bump and reload speed. Feeding Frenzy is the best for not needing precision hits, but Outlaw is great in the event that you can handle the bounce. Kill Clip is an easy 25%, but you could also opt for solar grenade builds with Demolitionist, or Dragonfly for some better add clear.
Masterworks: Stability

In PvP you will still want Arrowhead Brake. Ricochet Rounds is perfect for bringing up the low stability. Rangefinder currently is best in slot and you can couple that with Kill Clip for bonus damage. Competing slightly with Horror's Least and slightly with Autumn Wind.
Masterworks: Stability

Positive Outlook was one of my favorite guns from Year 1. I still have mine in my vault with 4,600 kills on it. Nothing better than old reliable Kill Clip from Curse of Osiris. This new version gives us access to Golden Tricorn, Destabilizing Rounds, and even Repulsor Brace making it a really great void option for anyone drawn to the void. Ambitious Assassin isn't a replacement for reload, but it does help make reloads feel a bit further away instead of making them faster.
Masterworks: Stability

In PvP I cannot reliably see a way to make Positive Outlook meta. Tap the Trigger and Kill Clip will give you the best footing for multikills and sprees. Eye of the Storm also helps win duels for a more consistent 1v1 experience. Both Zen Moment and Dynamic Sway Reduction could swap in for Tap the Trigger as your consistency perk.
Masterworks: Stability

Pressurized Precision is a great choice for a Strand fusion rifle. Discord will regenerate ammo for you as long as you get the kill, which will pair well with High-Impact Reserves or Vorpal for damage. Hatchling does not refund you ammo, but does pair well with Strand subclasses. Use whatever build you'd like.
Masterworks: Charge Time

In PvP I don't think Pressurized Precision is the best in its class. You can also get away with the Discord shenanigans but with zoom decoupling from Rangefinder soon I wouldn't rush out to get one. Firmly Planted did receive a nerf a while back and the effects can still be felt, it is not as consistent as it used to be. You can still make it work, but I would look elsewhere for a better fusion.
Masterworks: Range

Randy's Throwing Knife is back! My favorite little scout-auto love child. This time with random rolls!!! I do enjoy seeing older ritual / pinnacle weapons refreshed with more options, especially post sunsetting. It does feel good grinding them out again. Randy's Throwing Knife was the best rapid-fire scout for its time but unfortunately fell into a time where scouts were just awful to use and did not have a set place outside of MIDA Multi-Tool or a few specific options. Randy's Throwing Knife with Kinetic Tremors will feel great as it fires fast enough to get the AoE back to back. Cascade Point is really funny to me, seeing a 260 scout bumping the RPM all the way up to 428 via D2Foundry. If this lands for me I don't even really care about viability, it will just be fun.
Masterworks: Stability

Randy's Throwing Knife did find its slight niche within PvP, hopefully the new version delivers. I think it does and then some. The old version had Rapid Hit and Kill Clip, which you can get again, but with Extended Mag instead of a better mag boosting perk. You also have the option of bumping up the recoil direction making those quick headshots a lot easier. While the old Randy's Throwing Knife didn't have a bad roll, getting it again with slightly better options feels good.
Masterworks: Stability

The only problem with this submachine gun is the far too low stability. Rapacious Appetite has literally the lowest stability across all submachine guns in the game at 6. A whopping 6. You're going to want to bump that up even on MnK. You can drop the stability to zero, but I wouldn't recommend it. Well-Rounded does give some great stability to bring up Rapacious Appetite's extremely low stability. One for All is the easiest damage bonus to get as you won't need to get kills and your low stability will occasionally make crit kills harder, making Headstone less optimal. Frenzy also brings up your damage and reload which really helps out.
Masterworks: Stability

In PvP your best bet is Target Lock for the added damage and Encore for more stats. Perpetual Motion and Well-Rounded are also great for boosting stats. I really think you should be bringing up the stability as much as you can while maintaining as much range as possible.
Masterworks: Stability

Sole Survivor was one of the first snipers to get Firing Line and it proved incredibly strong. Rapid Hit on a boss will keep your reload super quick. Field Prep will bump up your reserves and also increase your reload speed. Outlaw only works on kills so it will be better if you pair it with Voltshot. Focused Fury or Vorpal Weapon are interchangeable because Focused Fury needs hits to start getting high damage, but Vorpal Weapon does less damage but is immediate.
Masterworks: Reload Speed

I loved Sole Survivor. My roll has over 800 PvP kills. The reprisal lost Opening Shot which immediately kills this sniper for me. It was introduced with Mercurial Overreach which I think was the PvP sniper Bungie wanted people to grind for, but I am upset I can't use my old one and the new one doesn't have the same perk pool. The best roll to get is with high handling and Snapshot. Eye of the Storm is the best in slot here.
Masterworks: Handling

Rapid Hit on the new Something New (ew that sentence was gross) is great. I love Rapid Hit and being able to have a harder hitting Eyasluna will be a nice addition. I find 120s to scale a bit better in higher end content, but until we get that hand cannon PvE damage buff I won't use this.

Will this replace your Round Robin? Probably not but it will be a good hand cannon if you, like me, don't have a crafted version yet. But having Rapid Hit instead of Keep Away is personal preference. Something New does have better stats in every category except handling where the two are tied. While the stat margins are not large it is something to note.
Masterworks: Reload Speed

I will guess that MnK players will prefer Round Robin for the bonus range with Keep Away as you value less stability than Controller players. Having enhanced perks will also be a big draw. While I implore you to try Something New I will not be upset if you disregard it and continue using Round Robin.
Masterworks: Stability

Spare Rations is back, and I am underwhelmed. In order to make this hand cannon work in PvE you'll want to use Rapid Hit for more stability and more importantly the reload bonus. Kinetic Tremors gives this hand cannon utility in higher tier activities. Vorpal Weapon can be used in lower tier activities against majors but I wouldn't bring Spare Rations into a GM. Focused Fury will give you some great damage to clear red bars and majors if you wanted to, but Spare Rations just isn't good enough for higher tiered activities.
Masterworks: Reload Speed

In PvP Spare Rations could make itself a small niche. It feels great to handle and has some great sights for solid 3-taps. It will not be able to out-range most of its competitors, but it will be able to comfortably out-handle most of them. Spare Rations beats out Thorn for handling and almost reaches 100 handling naturally.
Masterworks: Stability

There aren't many places I see myself using a grenade launcher in PvE nowadays. Cascade Point is very fun and Full Court will net you some solid damage from afar, but I find myself using rockets over grenade launchers. Maybe for GMs or activities where ammo is a bit more scarce and using a rocket launcher wouldn't be the best choice. Explosive Light really is carrying my weapons this season.
Masterworks: Blast Radius

In PvP you could definitely surprise a few players with an extra rapid rapid-fire frame grenade launcher with Cascade Point, but I find those groupings to be way less common than you think. Otherwise I would just go for Disruption Break to enhance my kinetic weapon.
Masterworks: Blast Radius

Targeted Redaction has a subpar perk pool. You can make this hand cannon work with Outlaw for faster reloads and your choice of fourth column perk. Collective Action gives you great damage without having to spec into any specific subclass. Destabilizing Rounds is fun with stacking void debuffs. Explosive Payload will help mitigate some damage fall off, which helps hand cannons in higher level activities, it also adds some outgoing flinch. I would probably take this perk last as other perks will be better overall, but it does help in PvE.
Masterworks: Stability, Reload Speed

In Crucible there is a small problem with this hand cannon, Behemoth Titan, and Collective Action. If you use this, you know who you are, you're going to get Collective Action Nerfed.* I hope it stays a 20% bonus in PvE, but it could be reduced there due to the PvP side. For a more neutral 120, Well-Rounded and Keep Away will bump up your stats and make this hand cannon feel a little less like a truck flailing in the wind when you use it.

*Edit, you did it, you got it nerfed. Good for you.
Masterworks: Stability

Techeun Force is looking to be the best fusion rifle in the game. I don't say that often but given all the goodies of double damage perks, craftability, and great stats you can really have it your way. Rewind Rounds coupled with Collective Action for subclass agnostic buffs, Controlled Burst for laying down enemies or Golden Tricorn when on Arc will feel incredibly strong. Reconstruction is a tried and true gem of a perk, only beaten by my obsession with Overflow. Kill Clip can stack with all of these creating over 100% damage increases with Kill Clip, Golden Tricorn 2x, 3 Surge Mods, and Major Spec. If you set things up right you can almost have a 150% damage increase. Simply put it is the best fusion in the game for damage and has greater utility beyond that.
Masterworks: Charge Time

In PvP you could also recommend Techeun Force as the best fusion in the game and I will. Arrowhead Brake with a CB mod brings the recoil to 100, so you can invest the rest of the fusion into range via Projection Fuse and Rangefinder. If you value kill chaining you could go for Reconstruction and Controlled Burst for never reloading and getting that 20% damage increase. Another niche use case would be Kill Clip and Kickstart for a nice 4 bolt kill, you'd have to be sprinting immediately after reloading but the enhanced version extending Kill Clip's timer will help you out.
Masterworks: Range

The Messenger returns to us. A once great pulse has returned to take its throne. Move aside No Time to Explain, we don't have time to explain how good Messenger is. Go away Graviton Lance, no one liked you before your multiple buffs. The king is back to retake the crown. Messenger needs a few things to make it the best roll possible, the first being Arrowhead Brake to bring up the low stability. Rapid Hit is the clear winner in the third column, but Outlaw is great if you don't want the change in burst pattern depending on what stack of Rapid Hit you have. Kill Clip is an easy damage buff, and Kinetic Tremors is fun for the AoE. Desperado fell off a bit, but I would still use it in PvE if I were looking for a good time.
Masterworks: Stability

A very similar situation is present in PvP. Arrowhead Brake and Rapid Hit are the staples to look out for. You can certainly get by without one or the other but the true King has both. Headseeker takes over for Desperado since the adjustment. Securing those blistering two-bursts is a feeling like no other. Headseeker makes those bursts more consistent and frequent.
Masterworks: Stability

The Messenger returns to us. A once great pulse has returned to take its throne. Move aside No Time to Explain, we don't have time to explain how good Messenger is. Go away Graviton Lance, no one liked you before your multiple buffs. The king is back to retake the crown. Messenger needs a few things to make it the best roll possible, the first being Arrowhead Brake to bring up the low stability. Rapid Hit is the clear winner in the third column, but Outlaw is great if you don't want the change in burst pattern depending on what stack of Rapid Hit you have. Kill Clip is an easy damage buff, and Kinetic Tremors is fun for the AoE. Desperado fell off a bit, but I would still use it in PvE if I were looking for a good time.
Masterworks: Stability

A very similar situation is present in PvP. Arrowhead Brake and Rapid Hit are the staples to look out for. You can certainly get by without one or the other but the true King has both. Headseeker takes over for Desperado since the adjustment. Securing those blistering two-bursts is a feeling like no other. Headseeker makes those bursts more consistent and frequent.
Masterworks: Stability

The Supremacy is one of the most stacked snipers to reach our feeble hands. Fourth Time's the Charm and Rewind Rounds coupled together gives you an unbelievable amount of ammo. Rapid Hit and Bait and Switch could be fun for maximum damage in a short period of time, and Kinetic Tremors with Lead from Gold could be a long distance add clear weapon.
Masterworks: Reload Speed

In PvP The Supremacy could be the strongest 140 we currently have. You can achieve an incredibly high 92 handling with both Opening Shot and Snapshot Sights. Only Mercurial Overreach can get that high. You can also hit 100 with Elemental Capacitor, but you would have to switch out some other perks to invest into range.
Masterworks: Handling

Thin Precipice is much more of a multi kill weapon, but falls off because it's a sword. If swords were more utilized in content it could be really fun with Chain Reaction for explosions, or your choice of Golden Tricorn or Collective Action for some really solid damage. You could potentially set up Thin Precipice for huge damage with surge mods and two stacks of Golden Tricorn to melt champions or even bosses. It's niche and would require more set up than your average boss killing weapon, but it would be crazy to see/
Masterworks: Impact

It's going to be a similar story to Just In Case for PvP. Unfortunately you have to make a choice this time. Either Valiant Charge or Tireless Blade. Personally I think Tireless is the best choice but I know people like harnessing their inner Sanic. Chain Reaction could potentially net you some double kills. Zoom in, get a double or more? I can see the montage now.
Masterworks: Impact

Transfiguration is a really solid scout mixed in with other really good scouts. Unfortunately, other scouts with similar rolls are already in most players' hands so there's less of a reason to grind for this. Rapid Hit and Kinetic Tremors already exists on Hung Jury and most players like the precision archetype better than the high-impact archetype. Explosive Payload is a tried and true perk combo that works here too. The enhanced versions of Rapid Hit and Explosive Payload don't add a ton to the weapon.
Masterworks: Reload Speed

In PvP there aren't a ton of reasons to use a high-impact scout. Jade Rabbit and Polaris Lance were dominant but not as strong any more. The rise and fall of scouts are typically accompanied by a slower game, pulses and SMGs are dominant right now because you're either playing passively or aggressively, there aren't too many middle avenues. Scouts cater to the former but on a higher end. If you do want to try this scout out in PvP you will need more than just Explosive Payload and some prayers.
Masterworks: Stability

Tyranny of Heaven used to be the only solar bow in the game, and its sights are really odd. In its current version you can certainly get some good mileage out of the updated perks, only if you can agree with the wonky sights. Archer's Tempo will get you the best reload / knock time, and Golden Tricorn is simply the best damage perk in the game. On solar that job gets even easier with the plethora of amazing abilities. Collective action will have slightly less uptime but could still be considered one of the better perks. Incandescent does give you some great AoE but I find that not bumping up the bow's innate damage might feel a bit lackluster in higher end activities.
Masterworks: Draw Time

In PvP please just don't use bows. The only way to one shot a guardian in PvP is by stacking 3 surge mods with Swashbuckler, or getting Golden Tricorn 2x going. While it is possible, and arguably sustainable within PvP it is incredibly niche. You can go a tried and true route with Snapshot Sights and any of the good third column perks but I would just use a precision frame instead.
Masterworks: Draw Time

Truthfully I don't know how to feel about the new glaive, it might need more time in my hands but it felt bad despite its beefed up stats. Thresh is great for getting super kills on both melee and powered shots. Subsistence for keeping the mag topped off or Feeding Frenzy for just reliable reload. I found the best success with Frenzy, but that's due to it being a straightforward damage bonus, your mileage may vary. Prove me wrong with this glaive.
Masterworks: Shield Duration

In PvP glaive users might find a niche with adept mods being present on the first ever adept glaive. While there are at least 3 of you I might finally encounter a wild glaive in the crucible. If you are set on using glaives in PvP you do not need me to tell you what works and what doesn't.
Masterworks: Range

Truthfully I don't know how to feel about the new glaive, it might need more time in my hands but it felt bad despite its beefed up stats. Thresh is great for getting super kills on both melee and powered shots. Subsistence for keeping the mag topped off or Feeding Frenzy for just reliable reload. I found the best success with Frenzy, but that's due to it being a straightforward damage bonus, your mileage may vary. Prove me wrong with this glaive.
Masterworks: Shield Duration

In PvP glaive users might find a niche with adept mods being present on the first ever adept glaive. While there are at least 3 of you I might finally encounter a wild glaive in the crucible. If you are set on using glaives in PvP you do not need me to tell you what works and what doesn't.
Masterworks: Range

I am really excited for this shotgun. Cascade Point and your choice of either Overflow or Auto-Loading Holster for Fourth Horseman-lite. You can opt for any of the mag bonuses to hit cap in order to slot in a Major or Boss Spec mod. Other options include Collective Action for a small everything buff, or Vorpal Weapon to stack with your spec mod.
Masterworks: Reload Speed

In PvP you're much better off using a different weapon as rapid-fire frames need two shots to reliably kill from a distance. If you are okay with that, then investing fully into handling and harmony for better damage after a kill would give you the best chance at competing with precision and aggressive frame shotguns.
Masterworks: Handling

Abyss Defiant is a high-impact auto rifle with arguably better perks than Ammit. Ammit doesn't have reliable reload perks but can definitely maintain great damage. Keeping all that damage, bumping it up a tad but slowing down the fire rate is Abyss Defiant's main claim to fame (that was a mouthful). Reconstruction and Subsistence with your flavor of damage perk will give you a reliable auto rifle to completely destroy whatever is standing in your way. The combination of Heal Clip and Kill Clip is nice to see.
Masterworks: Reload

High-impact autos in PvP are not strong. Can you slay out with them? For sure. Are they meta? Definitely not. Kill Clip is the strongest perk you can use on Abyss Defiant, and your choice of accuracy booster will keep your bullets true. Reconstruction is here for anyone who dislikes reloading. Eye of the Storm will help in pure 1v1 fights but will fall off in any 1v2+ fights. Swashbuckler could be fun with any of the melee heavy builds to get an incredibly fast 0.67s TtK with 4 crits and 1 body. (psst, with Radiant it becomes a 4 crit kill at 0.50s TtK, just FYI).
Masterworks: Stability

Abyss Defiant is a high-impact auto rifle with arguably better perks than Ammit. Ammit doesn't have reliable reload perks but can definitely maintain great damage. Keeping all that damage, bumping it up a tad but slowing down the fire rate is Abyss Defiant's main claim to fame (that was a mouthful). Reconstruction and Subsistence with your flavor of damage perk will give you a reliable auto rifle to completely destroy whatever is standing in your way. The combination of Heal Clip and Kill Clip is nice to see.
Masterworks: Reload

High-impact autos in PvP are not strong. Can you slay out with them? For sure. Are they meta? Definitely not. Kill Clip is the strongest perk you can use on Abyss Defiant, and your choice of accuracy booster will keep your bullets true. Reconstruction is here for anyone who dislikes reloading. Eye of the Storm will help in pure 1v1 fights but will fall off in any 1v2+ fights. Swashbuckler could be fun with any of the melee heavy builds to get an incredibly fast 0.67s TtK with 4 crits and 1 body. (psst, with Radiant it becomes a 4 crit kill at 0.50s TtK, just FYI).
Masterworks: Stability

Similar to how Geodetic HSM is the best sword for void mains, Acosmic GSp will be the best grenade launcher for void mains. Loose Change is a laughable perk on its own, but coupled with Destabilizing Rounds you won't need to rely as heavily on your abilities to get a whopping +50 reload speed. You'll be able to clear rooms with ease and be able to bridge your loadout into higher DPS weapons.
Masterworks: Blast Radius

Grenade launchers in PvP need to do two things. Hit their targets, and kill them. With high velocity coming at base with these grenade launchers you'll know your grenade gets to where it needs to go. Explosive Light will max out your blast radius and with how often you'll generate an orb the tricky part is actually securing heavy. Proximity Grenades will make this more forgiving. It might just take your heavy slot up from Wendigo.
Masterworks: Velocity

Brya's Love is probably the only weapon I will really grind out, and this is only for PvE. Brya's Love has some incredible perk combinations I would love to try out. Destabilizing Rounds on void has some incredible utility. Precision Instrument will probably take the cake as the next Vorpal Weapon being able to scale up damage with ease. Pair that with Rapid Hit to really get the most for your precision hits. Another great perk to craft would be Shoot to Loot to get your ammo and orbs from a distance. Not being required to chase after orbs is a pretty big benefit.
Masterworks: Handling, Reload Speed

In PvP Brya's could see some niche usage like a Box Breathing Hung Jury. I don't think it will be enough to break the meta but it will be a unique pick on longer ranged maps. I don't find myself swapping weapons depending on the map, but it would be a safe pick on Widow's Court or Eternity.
Masterworks: Stability

It's interesting when a PvP weapon has strong utility in PvE. Cataphract GL3 is one such example. With Envious Assassin and Bait and Switch you can really get some incredible damage out. Even reloader perks like Auto-Loading Holster and Field Prep are incredible too, it just depends on the damage cycle. Explosive Light and Chain Reaction are both tried and true combinations.
Masterworks: Reload Speed

In PvP there isn't much to talk about. Grenade launchers are the best in slot, Proximity Grenades allow you some forgiveness and Impulse Amplifier gives you a pocket rocket. Your best option for multikills is with Chain Reaction.
Masterworks: Velocity

It's interesting when a PvP weapon has strong utility in PvE. Cataphract GL3 is one such example. With Envious Assassin and Bait and Switch you can really get some incredible damage out. Even reloader perks like Auto-Loading Holster and Field Prep are incredible too, it just depends on the damage cycle. Explosive Light and Chain Reaction are both tried and true combinations.
Masterworks: Reload Speed

In PvP there isn't much to talk about. Grenade launchers are the best in slot, Proximity Grenades allow you some forgiveness and Impulse Amplifier gives you a pocket rocket. Your best option for multikills is with Chain Reaction.
Masterworks: Velocity

Deadpan Delivery is a great shotgun for most players looking for a "plug and play" shotgun. Being able to have Overflow and One-Two Punch for the highest damage show followed by the most One-Two Punch...punches. The only other synergy you could have asked for is Grave Robber for instant refresh on melee kills. However, on bigger bosses that might need a few more hits than your magazine allows this could slot in perfectly. Being Arc it also has some synergy with the Hunter class and can play into blinding / amplified builds. Discord is another interesting shout as you can run around with Frenzy for full uptime on damage and always having ammo to shoot with. Barrel Constrictor is an interesting perk for PvE as it makes sure all your pellets hit but it would be better paired with One-Two Punch instead of in the same column.
Masterworks: Reload Speed

I'm not going to lie. I got excited by this shotgun for one mere fact. Slickdraw. I know it's not everyone's cup of tea, but it has been mine for the past season. I have been slowly collecting Slickdraw weapons and changing crafted weapons to utilize Slickdraw. Now I know Slickdraw reduces your auto-aim cone size; it just means you have to be a bit more accurate when aiming. You can achieve a similar effect of Slickdraw by going with Arc Elemental Capacitor, Barrel Shroud, a Handling MW, and Quick Access Sling for 96 handling. This gives you a ready speed of 0.20s and an aim down sights speed of 0.23s. However just having Slickdraw drops you to the same ready speed and drops a hundredth of a second off of aim down sights. This means you can invest every other stat point into range. Bungie knew what they were doing when bringing in this weapon as Deadpan Delivery has the second lowest range stat of all Aggressive Frame shotguns even losing to the Uncommon Ded Nemoris II.
Masterworks: Handling

I am sure by now most players have a good rapid-fire machine gun in their arsenal. Whether that's Retrofit Escapade, Planck's Stride, Recurrent Impact, Shattered Cipher, or reaching all the way back even a Thermal Erosion. That being said, the only direct competition Eleatic Principle has is with Planck's Stride, which I think Eleatic Principle blows Planck's out of the water. Eleatic has access to Golden Tricorn which is the best damage perk in the game, or if you prefer not to use an arc subclass you could go with Target Lock for a slightly different Retrofit. You won't have access to a reload or mag extending perk but you can make the shots easier to land with Zen Moment, Well Rounded, or after some kills even Heating Up.
Masterworks: Stability

Eleatic Principle will live and die by the PvE metascene, so there isn't much hope for it in PvP. Moving Target or Zen Moment paired with Tap the Trigger will allow you to stay on target a bit with the 900 RPM, and if you're a good shot you could take advantage of Target Lock for a slight edge.
Masterworks: Stability

Fang of Ir Yut is back and is the first Crota's End weapon we will be talking about. It is a rapid-fire frame scout with some incredible perks. It might not be the strongest for PvP but for PvE we have some incredible perks. Rewind Rounds and Precision Instrument will keep your damage going and grant you extra bullets refunded. Rapid Hit also substitutes in here nicely as both perks require precision hits. Sword Logic is a new damage perk similar to Rampage or any other stackable buffs. Finally you can use this scout as a faster Taraxippus with Hatchling and Shoot to Loot to pick up orbs and ammo from a distance.
Masterworks: Reload

Fang isn't as strong over in the crucible where map design doesn't always lead to good scout rifle engagements. Being a rapid-fire frame does give this weapon an edge in closer gunfights but I would use another weapon for CQC. The best perks here are definitely Keep Away or Rapid Hit and Kill Clip. Rapid-fire frames feel incredible with Kill Clip active and the accuracy boost from Keep Away or the bonus stability from Rapid Hit will be appreciated.
Masterworks: Stability

Fang of Ir Yut is back and is the first Crota's End weapon we will be talking about. It is a rapid-fire frame scout with some incredible perks. It might not be the strongest for PvP but for PvE we have some incredible perks. Rewind Rounds and Precision Instrument will keep your damage going and grant you extra bullets refunded. Rapid Hit also substitutes in here nicely as both perks require precision hits. Sword Logic is a new damage perk similar to Rampage or any other stackable buffs. Finally you can use this scout as a faster Taraxippus with Hatchling and Shoot to Loot to pick up orbs and ammo from a distance.
Masterworks: Reload

Fang isn't as strong over in the crucible where map design doesn't always lead to good scout rifle engagements. Being a rapid-fire frame does give this weapon an edge in closer gunfights but I would use another weapon for CQC. The best perks here are definitely Keep Away or Rapid Hit and Kill Clip. Rapid-fire frames feel incredible with Kill Clip active and the accuracy boost from Keep Away or the bonus stability from Rapid Hit will be appreciated.
Masterworks: Stability

I think this is going to be the best weapon for low to mid-tier Void builds. Being able to use Destabilizing Rounds (swipes?), and Repulser Brace to debuff your enemies and buff yourself is incredible. You can clear entire rooms with only a few sword swipes and grant yourself an incredible over shield.
Masterworks: Impact

In PvP there are not many reasons to use this sword over Eager Edge or Valiant Charge.
Masterworks: Impact

I've seen some buzz with this sidearm. For one it is probably the easiest way to use Heal Clip as sidearms have naturally quick reload times. Cure also works better in PvE compared to PvP. Being able to scorch rooms with Incandescent and get some healing back like Unrelenting makes this a sidearm version of the CALUS-Mini Tool.
Masterworks: Range

I don't think the Heliocentric QSc will have as much fun in PvP. Kill Clip is the only solid fourth column perk, and while Rangefinder did get nerfed it will be strong on this sidearm for pushing out the AA, thus extending its feel. You'll still want to push out the range via Hammer-Forged Rifling, Accurized Rounds and a Range MW.
Masterworks: Range

So Horror Story is stasis now. Kinda cool, but not the biggest draw. The combo I'm looking for is Enlightened Action and Target Lock. The two of them together give you bonus handling, reload, and damage. As long as you're connecting shots you'll get the benefits of both!
Masterworks: Stability

In PvP you could swap out Enlightened Action for Dynamic Sway Reduction or maybe even Demolitionist. But I'd say that the handling bonus will feel really nice. A base of 37 handling isn't ideal, so the slight bonus from Arrowhead Brake coupled with Enlightened Action will make this auto rifle feel more like an SMG.
Masterworks: Range

Probably the most hyped weapon from this season. Rightfully so the Igneous Hammer is an incredible weapon. Rapid Hit and Incandescent for clearing rooms, or Golden Tricorn with solar builds to have the highest damage possible.
Masterworks: Reload Speed

Igneous Hammer is a real do-it-all but the crucible is where the Hammer can flex its wings. Keep Away with Eye of the Storm is going to be the best perk combo to look for. Fragile Focus is nice but requires you to not get hit. Rapid Hit is a great shout but you have to hit your crits in order to gain the benefits. Miss a shot and it's almost like starting from zero. If you want something that doesn't require you to get hit you can opt for Moving Target or Opening Shot to pair with Keep Away
Masterworks: Stability

Probably the most hyped weapon from this season. Rightfully so the Igneous Hammer is an incredible weapon. Rapid Hit and Incandescent for clearing rooms, or Golden Tricorn with solar builds to have the highest damage possible.
Masterworks: Reload Speed

Igneous Hammer is a real do-it-all but the crucible is where the Hammer can flex its wings. Keep Away with Eye of the Storm is going to be the best perk combo to look for. Fragile Focus is nice but requires you to not get hit. Rapid Hit is a great shout but you have to hit your crits in order to gain the benefits. Miss a shot and it's almost like starting from zero. If you want something that doesn't require you to get hit you can opt for Moving Target or Opening Shot to pair with Keep Away
Masterworks: Stability

Jurassic Green is an interesting pulse. It can roll Incandescent and Subsistence, but I think it shines with Golden Tricorn. You can make use of Heal Clip if you want a bit more healing but on solar hunter? This is going to be the bomb dot com.
Masterworks: Stability

Both rolls for PvP are very similar except for two differences in stat investments. On controller you'll want a bit more stability, on MnK you can invest those stat points into range. Headseeker and Keep Away are the key points, but definitely keep an eye out for Arrowhead Brake to correct that recoil direction.
Masterworks: Stability

Kept Confidence is getting a lot of hype but is it worth it? We have some incredible powerhouses in the same slot. Fatebringer, Austringer, Eyasluna, Spare Rations, and to a lesser extent D.F.A. and Dire Promise. What does Kept Confidence bring to the table? Well, in PvE not a whole lot. If you're constantly cycling debuffs it could be interesting, but not all subclasses have equal access to debuffs. Void warlock and hunter could be the strongest uptime with child and the smoke bomb applying debuffs. Otherwise I think this perk is mostly useless. It then leaves us with a dilemma; what is the best PvE perk on Kept Confidence for PvE? Stats for All is probably going to be your best bet. It leaves a lot to be desired, but is the best we can do. Pairing this with Collective Action or Multikill Clip are going to be your best bets. There aren't a lot of good combinations for PvE with this hand cannon.
Masterworks: Reload Speed

PvP is another story. There's really only one or two ways this hand cannon can work. You can either opt for a "win more" perk like Killing Wind or a more neutral perk like Quickdraw depending on how you play. Neither are exceptionally better than the other, but the main pairing for both is Eye of the Storm. Kept Confidence could have been released as a static weapon like Epochal Integration and people would still use the same perks. Your barrel and masterwork choice is really up to preference if you want more stability, handling, or range.
Masterworks: Range, Stability

Locus Locutus is a very fun name, but does the weapon hold up as well as its vocalization? To save you some reading, not really. You can get some great usage in PvE with Overflow and Firing Line for some great damage but we already have a better version in Thoughtless. Thoughtless beats out every stat of Locus Locutus except for the airborne effectiveness stat. Locus Locutus has +2 at 4. So the only stat Locus Locutus beats Thoughtless in is a waste stat. Both can roll Overflow and Firing Line. Both can also get Headstone. Kill Clip is unique to Locus Locutus but you have to ask yourself if Kill Clip is worth it in PvE.
Masterworks: Reload Speed

In PvP Thoughtless is hands down better. Thoughtless can roll Snapshot or Headstone. Perpetual Motion for a better handling bonus. The only reason you want to use Locus Locutus over Thoughtless is due to Opening Shot being stacked on Keep Away. This way you can stack fully into handling as enhanced Opening Shot and Keep Away with Accurized Rounds puts you at a flat 100 range. While not the most optimal in most Guardian's eyes, it will still be a solid weapon to use.
Masterworks: Handling

Luna Regolith III is the new vanguard sniper. Triple Tap and Clown Cartridge are the best in slot, but Field Prep will be great for longer damage phases. Firing Line is going to be your best damage buff, but Higher Ground will be good for solo players. It's not the most reliable as you can't always be higher than your target. But when it works, an extra 20% is an extra 20%.
Masterworks: Reload Speed

In PvP there are really only a few options. Max handling with Snapshot Sights and Opening Shot will be the most sought after roll. But I wouldn't be opposed to Eye of the Storm, Moving Target, or even one of my favorite silly perk combos: Opening Shot and Under Pressure. Previously this was only on the Occluded Finality with its monstrous zoom. That also helped in bullet bending, but as the majority of players prefer short zooms this will allow other players to enjoy my silly combo.
Masterworks: Handling

I've heard some incredible things about Malediction. Mostly that it feels like a 140 but hits like a 120. Enlightened Action is the best perk for 120s, it bumps up two of the lower stats of the archetypes; handling and reload. Explosive payload also bumps up the damage ever so slightly. Harmony and Discord work really well together to constantly have a full magazine and a damage bump for 7 seconds. You won't be able to keep up the damage bump, but the synergy is there.
Masterworks: Stability

In PvP the handling and gun feel continue here too. But you're only really going to use Explosive Payload and Enlightened Action. The stability bump from Flared Magwell, Fluted Barrel, and the stability MW make round out all the stats you need.
Masterworks: Stability

Mechabre returns in all its Gundam glory. In order to, in my humble opinion, get the most out of it in PvE, you'll want a base of 4 in your magazine. This way with Clown Cartridge there's a very high chance you'll be with 5 going into engagements. With Vorpal Weapon you won't need to hit crits in order to do good damage and you can take this solo without any drop in damage. Reload MW helps speed up those reloads getting you back to 4 or higher.
Masterworks: Reload

Eva spoiled us last year and gave us a god roll, snapshot and opening shot, right off the rip. This year she might not be so giving. If you're looking for max handling, fluted and a handling MW will get you there. You can also opt for Smallbore / Accurized Rounds / Range MW for max range. I am a little sour that Slickdraw was removed, especially after the buff. I might be in the less than 1% for that. Let me know if you miss Slickdraw.
Masterworks: Handling

Nightshade returns in its third, and hopefully, final glory. With a recoil direction of 56 you almost need Arrowhead Brake in order to fire at full RPM. In PvE I would highly recommend Flared Magwell or Light Mag depending on if you want range or stability. The added reload will feel incredible. You can then stack on Outlaw or Enlightened Action for better reload on top of that, or even Keep Away to bump out your range and handling. I find that in certain activities it is hard to keep enemies away all the time so you'll be constantly fighting whether the perk is up or not. Finally to round out the reload / damage perks you can use the easiest damage Nightshade has to offer, Collective Action. I find Kill Clip to be better as it's an ever so slightly higher damage bump. But depending on your build if you can create those elemental pickups it would be easier on Collective Action. Hatchling could work really well on Strand now that they received a slight buff.
Masterworks: Stability

Nightshade in PvP has had an interesting run. From being a viable option in Vanilla, to being passed over with random rolls, to being an off meta choice in its revival, to being outclassed, and finally returning again. What a ride. Arrowhead Brake is again my choice in barrels, but if you can control the recoil direction you can certainly opt for other options. Ricochet Rounds is the best in slot whenever it is available so please choose that. High-Caliber Rounds can work but I find neutrally the bump in stability outweighs possibly flinching off my opponent. In the third column it is all about Keep Away. Being able to get a range bump for free is incredible. I prefer Kill Clip for an easier time 1v2'ing as I am usually in a bad situation, but Headseeker is better neutrally for any 1vX situation as it's always on. With my roll choices you can have 100 recoil direction with a counterbalance mod and 32m of in game range. Plenty to take advantage of the bonuses of Keep Away.
Masterworks: Stability

Nox Perennial V is a great addition to your arsenal. Being able to roll with Envious Assassin and Controlled Burst in the Kinetic Slot is incredible. Lead from Gold if you prefer those builds or even just Collective Action for a neutral damage buff. Nox Perennial V's greatest strength isn't in its perk combinations, while they are strong, the biggest strength is in loadout flexibility. You can now use whatever energy weapon you'd like. T-Ghoul, Centrifuse, Sunshot, or any legendary weapon you prefer. You won't be stuck using kinetic weapons with a great fusion.
Masterworks: Charge Time

In PvP there's a similar but not quite the same story. Under Pressure with Kickstart is going to be the main play, but Elemental Capacitor is also great for boosting some lower stats. I wouldn't take this fusion into PvP unless you know you like High-Impacts but it could serve you well, again, in loadout flexibility.
Masterworks: Range

Did anyone ask for more rapid-fire frame pulses? It wasn't on my Bingo card. Either way Oversoul Edict is here and requires Arrowhead Brake in order to even shoot reliably. Even with Arrowhead and a Counterbalance Stock you'll be just shy of perfect at 94 recoil direction. Definitely great, but it's a shame you'll have to sacrifice a mod to make it feel like it's shooting where you point it. In PvE Oversoul Edict doesn't have the best reload perks. Keep Away and Precision Instrument are both great, Demolitionist can be strong on grenade heavy builds. The reason why I want a good reload perk like Outlaw or Rapid Hit is because of Voltshot. Being able to clear rooms with Voltshot is becoming more and more fun, but having to reload to get the zaps is less fun.
Masterworks: Stability

In PvP your best bet is to invest fully into reliability perks. Arrowhead / CB mod for recoil direction. Ricochet Rounds for stability. Keep Away for more range and some extra accuracy. Headseeker to keep those bursts consistent. If you play a bit more aggressively I can see Eye of the Storm being a great additional perk but it's not my first choice.
Masterworks: Stability

Did anyone ask for more rapid-fire frame pulses? It wasn't on my Bingo card. Either way Oversoul Edict is here and requires Arrowhead Brake in order to even shoot reliably. Even with Arrowhead and a Counterbalance Stock you'll be just shy of perfect at 94 recoil direction. Being able to clear rooms with Voltshot is becoming more and more fun, but having to reload to get the zaps is less fun.

In PvP your best bet is to invest fully into reliability perks. Arrowhead / CB mod for recoil direction. Ricochet Rounds for stability. Keep Away for more range and some extra accuracy. Headseeker to keep those bursts consistent. If you play a bit more aggressively I can see Eye of the Storm being a great additional perk but it's not my first choice.
Masterworks: Stability

Did anyone want more Rapid-Fire Frame snipers? I hope so because Persuader is here and ready to take up some vault space. The best PvE option is actually a throwback repeat to one of my first "DPS" snipers. Does anyone remember the Long Shadow with Rapid Hit and Triple Tap being the best we could have in Forsaken until Black Armory introduced us to Firing Line. Persuader is the best option for the older perk combo, but is still outclassed by other snipers in the current Sandbox. Supremacy and Praedyth's Revenge are both incredible for damage, and any Firing Line sniper will compete with this one for decent damage.
Masterworks: Reload Speed

Persuader also falls behind in the Crucible. It does have access to Surplus to reach 100 handling but you would either have to have all 3 stacks or 2 stacks with full investment into handling to maintain ability usage while keeping 100 handling. If you can maintain all your Surplus stacks and invest the rest of your stats into range you'll have 87 range and 100 handling and reload speed. Still incredible but then you remember it's a rapid-fire frame meaning you can't crit supers or double body.
Masterworks: Handling

This is arguably the best ritual weapon bungie introduced. It remains strong to this day only really outclassed by exotic bow buffs. The tried and true classic of Archer's Tempo and Vorpal Weapon remains, but you can get higher damage through Precision Instrument or Golden Tricorn on Arc. If you can maintain Golden Tricorn 2x you will for sure enjoy this bow.
Masterworks: Draw Time

Precision frame bows did not receive any buffs recently, so their lightweight brethren are feeling much better this season. I still think these bows are better for swapping but you let me know if you're finding success with lightweight blinting. Both Golden Tricorn 2x and Swashbuckler will allow you to 1 crit kill any guardian and Archer's Tempo will make the follow up kills easier.
Masterworks: Draw Time

Next up is a very interesting and arguable best in slot bow. Pre Astyanax IV is a solar bow rivaling Tyranny of Heaven and Strident Whistle, but neither can slot in adept mods. Adept Big Ones plus Precision Instrument will be an incredible combination. Incandescent for clearing rooms is another strong choice but I'm leaning towards Precision Instrument as the best in slot.
Masterworks: Draw Time

Pre Astyanax IV is not really meant for the crucible but you can achieve some really great stats through adept mods. Either lowering the draw time further or increasing the accuracy. Archer's Tempo is the best in slot, but you can pair that with a bunch of other perks like Opening Shot, Explosive Head, or even Successful Warm-Up for even faster follow up shots after a kill.
Masterworks: Draw Time

Next up is a very interesting and arguable best in slot bow. Pre Astyanax IV is a solar bow rivaling Tyranny of Heaven and Strident Whistle, but neither can slot in adept mods. Adept Big Ones plus Precision Instrument will be an incredible combination. Incandescent for clearing rooms is another strong choice but I'm leaning towards Precision Instrument as the best in slot.
Masterworks: Draw Time

Pre Astyanax IV is not really meant for the crucible but you can achieve some really great stats through adept mods. Either lowering the draw time further or increasing the accuracy. Archer's Tempo is the best in slot, but you can pair that with a bunch of other perks like Opening Shot, Explosive Head, or even Successful Warm-Up for even faster follow up shots after a kill.
Masterworks: Draw Time

Psi Heretic V has some incredible uses in PvE. It's not the absolute strongest weapon, but it will be a reliable workhorse if you need a pulse. Being one from the the highest damage archetype paired with Frenzy, or even Kill Clip you'll be able to have some great damage or stasis utility through Headstone. Outlaw is the best neutrally but Enlightened Action boosting the low handling will feel really nice.
Masterworks: Reload Speed

So Psi Heretic V is a great PvP pulse. Don't believe me? You can hit 100 stability with Smallbore / Steady Rounds / Void Elemental Capacitor / Stability MW, and you have your fourth column perk to do with as you please. Perpetual Motion for more handling and reload, Headseeker for more forgiving bursts, Kill Clip for a bit of chaining, Headstone for Stasis shenanigans. The world is your oyster. Crack it and find out what you want.
Masterworks: Stability

The new Gambit machine gun is a high-impact. Right away this will either entice you or drive you away. Field prep coupled with Target Lock will be my #1 roll. Increase the magazine size and slap on Arrowhead Brake for a really easy to use, high damage machine gun. Destabilizing Rounds will also do great as a single shot (in lower tiered content) will be able to kill an enemy and apply the debuff.
Masterworks: Reload Speed

There are not many uses for a high-impact machine gun in PvP. They require all crits but just feel extremely unforgiving. Anything to bump up the consistency will be greatly appreciated. Dynamic Sway Reduction or Under Pressure, and Ricochet Rounds will feel great. Rampage might not be the best but it does allow you to 3 crit 1 body any resilience and 2 crit 2 body all the way up to 7 resilience. Adrenaline Junkie isn't quite as strong on the low end. But if you can get a grenade kill you can 3 crit any resilience for a 0.33s TtK. Incredibly fast.
Masterworks: Stability

While this rocket is better than Crowning Duologue, it's because the bar was so low Semiotician almost tripped walking in this season. Semiotician has way too many vowels to be considered healthy, but has a decent enough perk tool to keep it around. Enhanced Field Prep and Enhanced Explosive Light are going to be tried and true. Thanks to one of my Patrons, we discovered with one reserve mod and enhanced Bipod you can have 15 rockets in reserves. The last possible perk combination is Impulse Amplifier with Frenzy as once Frenzy gets going you won't need the reload, so the added velocity is appreciated here.
Masterworks: Velocity

High-Impact Frames are generally regarded as the best rocket archetype to use. Great blast radius for splash damage. Semiotician doesn't have any incredible AoE perks like Chain Reaction or Cluster Bomb for multikills but it does have Explosive Light to max out the blast radius, it's easy enough to get orbs, and you'll be able to nuke supers with Explosive Light.
Masterworks: Handling

I did not participate in the raid race, but this weapon was one of the first to reach my ears on being a potential monster. Bait and Switch can put out some incredible damage, and you get to pair it with either Reconstruction or Rewind Rounds, both will extend your magazine and allow you to keep the DPS going. If you prefer less weapon swapping I would go Target Lock to keep damage up and really lay into that boss. Sword Logic or Voltshot are both great at clearing rooms and your choice will depend on how you feel about reloading a machine gun.
Masterworks: Reload

Machine guns have not had a dominant presence in PvP since Hammerhead was sunset (RIP). You can make Song of Ir Yut feel great by bumping up all its stats. Elemental Capacitor will juice up Void or Arc builds while having slightly less utility on Stasis and negligible effects on Strand and Solar. I would argue it's better than Target Lock because you'll only be getting half a magazine in PvP but if the damage scales like I think it does, it could be incredible (I'll edit this if I am wrong.)
Masterworks: Range

I did not participate in the raid race, but this weapon was one of the first to reach my ears on being a potential monster. Bait and Switch can put out some incredible damage, and you get to pair it with either Reconstruction or Rewind Rounds, both will extend your magazine and allow you to keep the DPS going. If you prefer less weapon swapping I would go Target Lock to keep damage up and really lay into that boss. Sword Logic or Voltshot are both great at clearing rooms and your choice will depend on how you feel about reloading a machine gun.
Masterworks: Reload

Machine guns have not had a dominant presence in PvP since Hammerhead was sunset (RIP). You can make Song of Ir Yut feel great by bumping up all its stats. Elemental Capacitor will juice up Void or Arc builds while having slightly less utility on Stasis and negligible effects on Strand and Solar. I would argue it's better than Target Lock because you'll only be getting half a magazine in PvP but if the damage scales like I think it does, it could be incredible (I'll edit this if I am wrong.)
Masterworks: Range

Swordbreaker is the returning shotgun from Crota's End. Here we have a case of "interesting but not incredible." Being able to get both Pugilist and One-Two Punch is a fantastic combo, but I feel that most people will opt for Subsistence to forget what reloading is like. Demolitionist is good for grenade heavy builds and also for forgetting the reload animation. In the final column, One-Two Punch is the best in slot, but on a Strand ability focused build you can get away with Golden Tricorn for even more damage. Sword Logic is also here if you want to run through enemies like Doom Guy and shotgun everything.
Masterworks: Reload

Swordbreaker is interesting. It might take the place of the best lightweight frame shotgun. Being craftable, tying with the highest handling within its archetype, and being able to hit 100 range are just a few things that makes Swordbreaker interesting. You can choose a variety of different perks, you only need one handling perk and Threat Detector to hit 100 handling with an animation scalar, meaning you can invest the rest of your perks into range. Going with Smallbore, Accurized Rounds, and Opening Shot puts you at 91 range and 100 handling. Or you can opt for 100 range and 91 handling by swapping a few things around. The best part of this shotgun is its versatility.
Masterworks: Handling, Range

Swordbreaker is the returning shotgun from Crota's End. Here we have a case of "interesting but not incredible." Being able to get both Pugilist and One-Two Punch is a fantastic combo, but I feel that most people will opt for Subsistence to forget what reloading is like. Demolitionist is good for grenade heavy builds and also for forgetting the reload animation. In the final column, One-Two Punch is the best in slot, but on a Strand ability focused build you can get away with Golden Tricorn for even more damage. Sword Logic is also here if you want to run through enemies like Doom Guy and shotgun everything.
Masterworks: Reload

You can choose a variety of different perks, you only need one handling perk and Threat Detector to hit 100 handling with an animation scalar, meaning you can invest the rest of your perks into range. Going with Smallbore, Accurized Rounds, and Opening Shot puts you at 91 range and 100 handling. Or you can opt for 100 range and 91 handling by swapping a few things around. The best part of this shotgun is its versatility.
Masterworks: Handling, Range

The Eremite is an interesting fusion. If you didn't farm out an Envious Assassin / Controlled Burst Loaded Question from last season you can get a solar version this season. You can even craft it to your liking. If you prefer Golden Tricorn for a higher damage ceiling or Reservoir Burst for clearing out rooms of enemies. The possibilities are truly yours to harness. Lead from Gold and Heal Clip can be really nice additions too depending on your full loadout.
Masterworks: Charge Time

I'm sure most people have seen u/Legoleflash's new video on the Eremite (if you haven't, go watch it here). Essentially the main point is enhanced Slickdraw doesn't feel terrible and allows you to full send into range. With Slickdraw maxing out your handling you can even opt for handling reducing perks like Full Bore, or, better yet, Extended Barrel for a bump in recoil direction. If you don't like Slickdraw there you could opt for Offhand Strike and find a good balance of range and stability.
Masterworks: Range, Charge Time

The Guiding Sight is similar to Nightshade with multiple revisions. Originally in Vanilla, and then dropping again in Season of the Hunt. Can we get a new gun? The Guiding Sight did lose one of its biggest attractors, the scopes you can select. Now with just barrels the best one is Arrowhead Brake to bring the recoil all the way to 100. Precision Instrument will be strong on this gun because you can keep a safe distance and still keep putting out incredible damage. Enlightened Action will also bring up the gun feel and help your reload.
Masterworks: Handling

Now, while you can 3 crit at 0.80 at nearly every distance. I don't think this scout will be really strong in the close range. Fluted Barrel and Ricochet Rounds will bring up the low stats. Perpetual Motion and Enlightened Action will both boost your stats further and Kill Clip will allow you to 2 crit 1 body in the close range. It's not the strongest scout in the game. But it is now another high-impact scout with Kill Clip.
Masterworks: Stability

The Showrunner returns to us in an interesting time. I know I will be using it but that's because it can roll with an ever so elusive combination of Grave Robber and Swashbuckler. The Showrunner being the second lightweight frame with this combo and the first in the Kinetic Slot. For me this works well with all my titan builds and my titan brain. However, if you're not on a punch subclass or the master class then opting for something like Overflow and Kinetic Tremors will be a great combo. Overflow allows you to get 72 bullets per magazine, allowing for a whopping 7 Kinetic Tremor activations; and that's just at base. The only other weapon to get this combination is Buzzard but the lower magazine on Buzzard really holds it back, only getting 3 per overflow. This doesn't mean you can't get more than that by constantly walking over bricks to refill the magazine, but let's be honest I haven't done that subconsciously and I love Overflow.
Masterworks: Reload Speed

In PvP The Showrunner is going to be the least used SMG this season right behind Unending Tempest. Go see why I think that SMG is better in the Vendor breakdown. The Showrunner has some great perks in Target Lock and Dynamic Sway Reduction, Rangefinder if you're really looking for consistency at range, or more neutral perks like Well Rounded or Heating Up. However, the issue is really the frame we were given. Lightweight SMGs are not "in the spotlight." While I think this SMG can serve you well as a kinetic Funnelweb the perks to note aren't as strong. You can almost hit 100 range with Full Bore, Ricochet, Well Rounded 2x, and Fragile Focus, but that sacrifices Target Lock and Dynamic Sway Reduction for only 23m of range.
Masterworks: Stability

Another season, another bajillion perks in our core weapons. Unending Tempest comes in as the first core playlist 600 rpm submachine gun. We have had Aggressives come from Crucible and Gambit. Lightweights from Crucible and Vanguard. So no Precision Frames. The biggest synergy is Demolitionist and Adrenaline Junkie. Enlightened Action and any damage bonus will also feel incredible. And of course there's Subsistence and Frenzy for damage and never having to reload.
Masterworks: Reload Speed

Unending Tempest will be the next best submachine gun. Rivaling but not as strong as release The Immortal. The only issue is the large perk pool, but you can always work around that by playing crucible for more resets. The best perks depend on how you play. Killing Wind will help you get to and beat out your next engagement, Multikill Clip works here, but Kill Clip would have been better. Dynamic Sway Reduction will help keep your bullets on target paired with Target Lock for that quick TtK. Finally you could also try to hit max range with Fragile Focus and boost up your other stats with Perpetual Motion. It's definitely going to be a dominant SMG this season, and if you prefer precision SMGs like myself it will be worth the grind.
Masterworks: Range

Warden's Law got a buff recently and allows it to feel more like a hybrid Crimson. The two burst, feeling almost like a short version of Revision Zero or Graviton Lance. That's not a bad thing by the way. In PvE you'll want Fourth Time's the Charm, which should actually work on this gun, coupled with Vorpal Weapon for the highest damage and best mag utilization. For a more neutral weapon something like Enlightened Action and Frenzy for damage, reload, and handling all wrapped up into one.
Masterworks: Reload Speed

I would like to get my hands on a Warden's Law with Zen Moment to see if I can completely ignore stability as one trigger pull will grant my 4 stacks (2 per hit). It would feel incredible with that and Moving Target for more aim assist. Rampage and Kill Clip can both make the two burst easier and require less crits, but it won't be enough to one burst on its own. Kill Clip with a Ward of Dawn will be able to one burst dealing 124 to the head and 78 to the body. Really easy to down an enemy in record time.
Masterworks: Stability

Warden's Law got a buff recently and allows it to feel more like a hybrid Crimson. The two burst, feeling almost like a short version of Revision Zero or Graviton Lance. That's not a bad thing by the way. In PvE you'll want Fourth Time's the Charm, which should actually work on this gun, coupled with Vorpal Weapon for the highest damage and best mag utilization. For a more neutral weapon something like Enlightened Action and Frenzy for damage, reload, and handling all wrapped up into one.
Masterworks: Reload Speed

I would like to get my hands on a Warden's Law with Zen Moment to see if I can completely ignore stability as one trigger pull will grant my 4 stacks (2 per hit). It would feel incredible with that and Moving Target for more aim assist. Rampage and Kill Clip can both make the two burst easier and require less crits, but it won't be enough to one burst on its own. Kill Clip with a Ward of Dawn will be able to one burst dealing 124 to the head and 78 to the body. Really easy to down an enemy in record time.
Masterworks: Stability

Oh hey, another Void 180 hand cannon. I wonder how many of these we have? Not counting sunset weapons, it's 3. But counting them in it's 6. I guess I thought there were more. Word of Crota is an interesting 180. If you crafted a good IKELOS_HC_v1.0.3 then you won't need this one. If you didn't craft one, then this will be a great option. Subsistence as we know allows us to bypass the reload stat and your choice of damage perks will slot in perfectly. One combo to keep an eye on is the Repulsor Brace / Destabilizing Rounds combo. It won't scale up to GM levels but in entry level PvE activities it can put in great work.
Masterworks: Handling

Precision frame hand cannons are not meta in PvP. Killing Wind and a damage perk can make you competitive after a kill, but that's just it. It has to be after an initial kill. For most players a 120 or a 140 will do better, just keep in mind a grenade kill with Adrenaline Junkie puts you a 0.67s TtK only requiring 2 crits and 1 body shot. Similar to Kill Clip or old Not Forgotten / Luna's Howl era. You do need to get a grenade kill first, but it can wipe teams.
Masterworks: Range

Oh hey, another Void 180 hand cannon. I wonder how many of these we have? Not counting sunset weapons, it's 3. But counting them in it's 6. I guess I thought there were more. Word of Crota is an interesting 180. If you crafted a good IKELOS_HC_v1.0.3 then you won't need this one. If you didn't craft one, then this will be a great option. Similar to Kill Clip or old Not Forgotten / Luna's Howl era. You do need to get a grenade kill first, but it can wipe teams.
Masterworks: Range

A Sudden Death is not a great shotgun for PvE, while you do have Envious Assassin and One-Two Punch which together allow you to never worry about reloading, I find rapid-fire frames at the opposite end of the shotgun spectrum better for One-Two Punch. Trench Barrel and Grave Robber are great combinations for "maining" this shotgun but an even better combination would be Destabilizing Rounds and Repulsor Brace, the issue with this combo is that it's a shotgun and not a primary ammo weapon.
Masterworks: Range, Stability, Handling, Reload Speed

I used all my "creator" luck on my own personal Sudden Death, which I am very happy with. Threat Detector and Opening Shot are going to be the tried and true combinations. If you rock exotics like Ophidians, Dragon's Shadow, or even Speedloader Slacks you can go with Slideshot, and those who love arc will love Elemental Capacitor. Opening Shot regardless of third column perk is still your best bet.
Masterworks: Range, or Handling

What a missed opportunity for an underutilized sword to have a specific niche. How interesting would it be if Bungie introduced a double zoom sword. Valiant Charge and Eager Edge. Swap to the sword for your first zoom, block on your way for a second. Be able to zoom in two different directions or one direction for a huge zoooom. Without that it falls into a large category of underused adaptive frame swords.
Masterworks: Impact

As with most adaptive frame swords, they're not great in PvP. At least not this one. Valiant Charge is great for closing the distance but it's not incredible
Masterworks: Impact

Adhortative is an adaptive solar pulse rifle most similar to Forge's Pledge. Adhortative has better range, handling, and recoil direction, while losing in stability, reload speed and airborne effectiveness. Either pulse is only better than the other by less than 3 points in each category, except for airborne effectiveness and recoil direction, 9 and 10 respectively. Between these two for PvE, Adhortative wins purely for having a reload perk in Feeding Frenzy. If you don't care about that, either can work.
Masterworks: Reload Speed

With such a similar pulse existing in PvP it comes down to perks. Forge's Pledge gets access to Accurized and Steady Rounds, while Adhortative comes with High-Caliber and Ricochet Rounds. Forge's Pledge comes with Zen Moment and Elemental Capacitor for big bonuses in stats, while Adhortative has Headseeker or Incandescent for better neutrality or some AoE. Depending on your preferred play style you might prefer one over the other, but I cannot emphasize this enough: both can work wonders.
Masterworks: Stability

Precision frame submachine guns are not good in PvE content, their low handling, reload speed, and stability are all important factors when mowing down waves of enemies. Subsistence and Feeding Frenzy both improve one of those limitations but I wouldn't invest into those to make up for it. Onslaught will make Adjudicator feel more like other archetypes but won't replace them.
Masterworks: Reload Speed

Adjudicator is back and I was really hoping for a replacement for my Antiope-D, while this isn't it I can confidently use this for a similar feel. Dynamic Sway Reduction will keep those bullets tight and on target while Target Lock will adjust your optimal TtK. Onslaught is probably going to be on my personal roll, but I'll have to actually get it to drop first.
Masterworks: Range

I don't know how often this glaive will be used over the crafted glaives but there's a nice niche between Beacon Rounds and Close to Melee. If you get any glaive kill you'll activate Beacon Rounds, with the added tracking you can shoot off in the general direction of a thrall and with that kill you'll activate Close to Melee to deal an extra 30% more melee damage. Any additional damage with your melee or projectile you'll keep up Beacon Rounds and Close to Melee to continue the chaining of better tracking and better damage.
Masterworks: Range

With Auxiliary Reserves you get some great shield duration. With Light Mag and Keep Away you negate the reload speed loss from Auxiliary Reserves. All the range gives you a velocity of 130 m/s which is 1.11x times faster than the base 117 m/s. This extra speed will make the hit registration feel better. If you can manage to get Golden Tricorn 2x with one surge mod you can one hit kill any guardian 6 resilience or below. As you add one surge mod you can down an additional resilience tier. It scales 1:1.
Masterworks: Range

Appetence is our first weapon. Being a stasis trace rifle already gives Appetence viability in a lot of loadouts. No longer are you tied to Ager's Scepter for a "kinetic" trace rifle. Appetence is also legendary so you open up a plethora of loadout possibilities. In PvE you can make the most of this trace rifle with Overflow and Killing Tally for a 21% Delirium-lite. Being able to walk over bricks of special to double the magazine capacity keeps Killing Tally primed and ready to rip into any wave of enemy you might have in front of you. If you prefer a more calculated approach or don't want to use just one weapon, Headstone is extremely strong with the buffed Stasis subclasses.
Masterworks: Reload Speed

Taking Appetence into the crucible might be a big test of your patience. Already having low ammo, and the current economy of ammo bricks will severely limit your overall usage. If you can horde ammo bricks like Scrooge you can certainly make this weapon work better. Enlightened Action will make the weapon feel better, and Headstone can deny revives or build into the Stasis subclass like in PvE. Killing Tally can work if you use nothing but this trace rifle but I wouldn't advise it.
Masterworks: Range

How many bullets can you shoot before reloading? Will this be a power weapon alternative of Sweet Business? Quite possibly. With Actium War Rig, Extended Mag, and Rewind Rounds you'll never have to reload before the target is dead. Especially so if you stack on damage from a spec mod and Vorpal Weapon.
Masterworks: Reload

While you don't see many machine guns running around in the crucible, you can with Avalanche. Arrowhead Brake brings up the recoil direction to 100. Adding in either range or stability (or both) with Dynamic Sway Reduction will make the shooting experience enjoyable. Incandescent is a bit of an odd choice but being able to apply some Scorch and make the second kill easier will allow you to go on a nice spree.
Masterworks: Stability

This season's Competitive weapon. Belisarius-D is already making waves as one of the strongest pulse rifles with a ton of combinations. It might not be as good as pre-nerf No Time to Explain, but it certainly holds its own in our current Meta. Arrowhead isn't necessary with our deterministic recoil, but I found the bursts a bit tighter and easier to control. I like that Vorpal Weapon can be paired with Kill Clip for extra damage against majors and champions. Rapid Hit is a better neutral perk for cleaning up the burst and adding much needed reload speed.
Masterworks: Stability

Belisarius-D comes from the crucible, and it belongs in the crucible. Rapid Hit and Headseeker are fantastic neutral perks that no one would argue belong together. Keep Away and Moving Target can substitute as well for a very strong neutral weapon. Eye of the Storm is conditional in that you will have to take damage, but the benefits far outweigh the drawbacks. In the crucible you will be taking damage, so getting some extra benefits alongside that is all upsides. Kill Clip doesn't change the time to kill enough to be noticeable unless you hit nothing but headshots. In which case you'll drop down to a 0.60 TtK with 6 crits on Tier 8 Resilience or below. Without Kill Clip on those higher tiered resilience levels you'll need 1 extra bullet, either way it still remains a two-burst as you won't stop the burst mid-burst.
Masterworks: Stability

Blast Furnace is probably the best feeling 450 aggressive frame pulse. Personally I liked the Meyrin RDL scope as it highlighted targets, but I can understand it wasn't everyone's cup of tea. The best combo that I will be farming for will be Kinetic Tremors and Firefly for AoE on top of AoE. Keep Away also serves as a good reload perk, while also making it easier to get yellow numbers. Shoot to Loot combined with Firefly will allow you to pick up orbs and ammo from afar.

The curated roll of Blast Furnace comes with Perpetual Motion and Kill Clip allowing you to bump up your stats by moving and get extra damage on top. While I don't believe it's the best roll overall, it does allow for some utility in both PvE and PvP.
Masterworks: Range, Stability, Handling, Reload Speed

Over in the Crucible Blast Furnace has yet to make its mark. It has some stiff competition in the form of both Belisarius-D and Disparity. Both of which come with some incredible rolls. Outside of its frame you have some other strong pulses like the new Relentless or Messenger (Adept). Blast Furnace does have a leg up over recent additions with the combination of Zen Moment and Kill Clip for easy follow-up two burst kills. Outside of S16 Messenger (which might not be possible due to the perk updates) no other aggressive frame pulse has that combination. (Elsie's Rifle also gets this combo but we will talk about that later).

Another lethal combo is Headseeker and Kill Clip which allows for double damage, the only other pulse to get this combination is Chattering Bone.
Masterworks: Stability

Blast Furnace is probably the best feeling 450 aggressive frame pulse. Personally I liked the Meyrin RDL scope as it highlighted targets, but I can understand it wasn't everyone's cup of tea. The best combo that I will be farming for will be Kinetic Tremors and Firefly for AoE on top of AoE. Keep Away also serves as a good reload perk, while also making it easier to get yellow numbers. Shoot to Loot combined with Firefly will allow you to pick up orbs and ammo from afar.

Masterworks: Range, Stability, Handling, Reload Speed

Outside of its frame you have some other strong pulses like the new Relentless or Messenger (Adept). Blast Furnace does have a leg up over recent additions with the combination of Zen Moment and Kill Clip for easy follow-up two burst kills.
