(Elsie's Rifle also gets this combo but we will talk about that later).

Another lethal combo is Headseeker and Kill Clip which allows for double damage, the only other pulse to get this combination is Chattering Bone.
Masterworks: Stability

Breakneck returns to us in all its glory. Onslaught paired with Subsistence gives you the best of both worlds. A faster shot and Actium War Rig-lite. Feeding Frenzy is a nice second but you don't want to stop firing to lose the damage buff. Onslaught itself also gives you a nice bonus to reload on its own. The obvious choice then is to bump up the magazine and recoil direction to make shooting last longer and be a little easier at those maximum stacks.
Masterworks: Handling

Breakneck is one of those weapons where if you like it, you'll use it everywhere no matter what. It isn't incredible in the crucible, but it can hold its own as a precision frame auto rifle. Breakneck gets a touch of SUROS Regime by either speeding up the RPM post kill with Onslaught or slowing it down with Adagio. Depending on how you play, one might feel better than the other. If you're not looking for a legendary SUROS I'd recommend consistency perks to have a reliable precision frame from gunfight to gunfight.
Masterworks: Range

Our full ritual playlist weapon is an interesting one. Caster frame swords have not been strong since their introduction. So Bungie is either testing us to see if they should buff caster frames or trying to get more hands on feedback. I feel like caster frames are a tough one to balance. Give them too much damage and they become an extremely safe pick in everyday play. Lower the ammo requirements and you will inadvertently buff their DPS as you'll have more opportunities to use the heavy attack. Lower their charge time to counterbalance either of those changes and we're back to square one. Chivalric Fire is a great neutral sword that works best on Void subclasses, but you can utilize either orb generation or volatility to great success without committing to Void.
Masterworks: Impact

I would not recommend using these swords in PvP. They have utility as a legendary Black Talon, but the tracking is horrendous comparatively.
Masterworks: Impact

While there aren't a lot of amazing submachine guns, Cold Front is reliable in that we get Subsistence and Frenzy for low level PvE activities. It's not going to replace any of your more specified submachine guns for any particular subclass. But if you want something to turn your brain off and still clear rooms with ease. Cold Front can be it.
Masterworks: Stability

Now I know what you're saying, Rangefinder was nerfed. I know it was. But having lower range for the SMG class you'll feel some of the forgiveness factors from Rangefinder coupled with Tap the Trigger bringing you better accuracy and stability.
Masterworks: Stability

Crux Termination IV is an incredibly strong weapon this season. Not only does it get access to one of the best damage perks but also some of the best mag extending perks. Explosive Light and your choice of Reconstruction, Envious Assassin, or even Clown Cartridge are all great within their own right. Impact Casing is nice for additional damage, but it isn't extremely mandatory.
Masterworks: Velocity

Slideshot on a rocket is certainly interesting. I wouldn't recommend it as a meta choice but more of a novelty. Is it niche? For sure. Will you pick up ammo, and be able to slide to reload back to back shots? Not outside of Mayhem. Would it be cool? I think this gun speaks for itself.
Masterworks: Velocity

Darkest Before is now changed up and swapped to solar. With this change it synergizes better with solar subclass verbs. Heal Clip and Incandescent are fantastic together and allow you to push out your engagement ranges a bit further because it's a pulse rifle. The issue I have with this is that Darkest Before is a rapid-fire frame, meaning it does really low damage per shot. Sometimes needing two or even three bursts for a red bar. Almost any other frame would be incredible. What a shame.
Masterworks: Reload Speed

Darkest Before in PvP lost a little bit of arc shenanigans, but gained a better perk pool. Elemental Capacitor and Headseeker will make for an extremely consistent or snappy pulse on void or solar, respectively. Kill Clip and Heal Clip together make for a lethal and synergistic build. I don't foresee Darkest Before becoming the king of pulses, but definitely a top contender for those rapid-fires.
Masterworks: Stability

We have ourselves the second craftable non-raid aggressive frame linear fusion rifle. Holy traveler. Say that sentence 5 times fast. I think Doomed Petitioner will be slightly more used over Fire and Forget due to a reload bypassing perk in Reconstruction. Pair that with either Golden Tricorn on void or Precision Instrument to really crank up those stacks within two shots. Envious Assassin works well if you're slaying enemies before your damage phase while Reconstruction works well passively.
Masterworks: Charge Time

I adore these fusions for PvP, they just feel nice. Unfortunately they're only slightly outclassed by grenade launchers in our current meta and swords are way more mobile. This doesn't leave a lot of room for them to shine. Keep Away and Moving Target will buff your accuracy and aim assist while also giving a nice bonus to range and movement, respectfully. You'll want to lower the charge time as low as you can and the origin trait will also help with that.
Masterworks: Charge Time

Adaptive frame swords in PvE are a dime a dozen. There are not a lot of compelling reasons to go for this sword unless you have yet to find the Repulsor Brace / Destabilizing Rounds Nasreddin in the wild.
Masterworks: Impact

I wouldn't use this sword over a zoom sword in PvP.
Masterworks: Impact

Dragoncult Sickle is our last dungeon weapon. Being a strand caster frame might actually benefit the toolkit a bit more. Being able to spread Sever through Slice and Chain Reaction or spawn Threadlings from a distance makes this weapon an incredibly strong addition to an all Strand loadout. It might not be the best for boss damage or the best for add clear, but I think it will find a nice home in some Strand loadouts.
Masterworks: Impact

Dragoncult Sickle might have some utility in PvE but PvP is not as forgiving. Assassin's Blade allows you to run a bit faster when you get a kill, and chain reaction will allow you to get some cheeky double kills or team wipes. I like the idea of caster frames in PvP but in practice you're better of using another sword.
Masterworks: Impact

Oh how the meme's be meme'ing. Edge Transit used to drop as often as glimmer. We used to be swimming in them, with how often they used to drop. Now we are asking for more drops of Edge Transit. The hottest DPS weapon outside of Cataphract GL3 (Adept). For the moment we can stack extra rounds into the magazine with Augmented Drum and Envious Assassin, and then hot swap over to Spike Grenades and Cascade Point on some Holo-foil rolls. Pair that with either Explosive Light or Bait and Switch for incredible damage. Bait and Switch will last the whole extended magazine, but (soon to be) enhanced Explosive Light will last 7 shots. If you nail just one roll out of all the Edge Transits I would look for Cascade Point and Explosive Light to be able to nuke most majors, champions, and bosses with ease.

The curated roll for Edge Transit is Envious Assassin and Destabilizing Rounds for some great synergy with Void builds. It's not incredible but if you've never used Cascade Point it's a great place to start.
Masterworks: Velocity

The extra health added with the 7.3.5 update made a big switch to heavy grenade launcher perks. Now you'll need to invest heavier into Blast Radius to hit around 65+ in order to reliably OHK a guardian of all resilience levels. Volatile Launch with a Blast Radius MW gets us to 75, High-Explosive Ordinance brings that up to 85 and evens out the hit to velocity from Volatile Launch. Paired up with Impulse Amplifier and you'll hardly notice a difference compared to a max velocity roll without Impulse Amplifier. With the perk shake up I'd personally take Explosive Light in the fourth column to bring the blast radius up to 100 and get some extra explosion damage but Destabilizing Rounds is also good if you're looking for a pseudo-Chain Reaction.
Masterworks: Blast Radius

Masterworks: Blast Radius

Elsie's Rifle is a throwback to D1, and another good weapon Bungie could have brought back was Murmur, the element switching fusion from the Moon. Jokes aside, Elsie's Rifle is incredible. Rewind Rounds or Feeding Frenzy paired with Desperate Measures or Desperado, any combination of the above will be more than lethal. Arrowhead Brake is a must have regardless of what activity you bring this rifle into, I don't know if there's a small bug within the timelines of this rifle but having Arrowhead Brake fixes a large majority of issues.

The curated version of Elsie's Rifle comes with Rewind Rounds and Adrenaline Junkie. Adrenaline Junkie pairs really well with the origin trait and Rewind Rounds, allowing you to get grenade energy back on top of nearly endlessly firing. It's like No Time to Explain-lite with Rewind Rounds. If you're not looking for Desperate Measures or Desperado you could even stop here.
Masterworks: Reload Speed

Like I mentioned earlier, Arrowhead Brake is a must have. This will make your two bursts far easier. Zen Moment and Headseeker allow you consistent two bursts. Depending on how that feels you might instead want Keep Away for better accuracy from a distance. Zen Moment and Kill Clip are also present, giving you some flexibility if you don't like Blast Furnace or aggressive burst pulse rifles.
Masterworks: Stability

Here is a weapon that should not see much use in PvE. Unsurprisingly a PvP weapon is good in PvP, Eye of Sol returns but without Outlaw, Field Prep, or any real good reload perk. Nothing exists on Eye of Sol that will propel it to see any use in general PvE other than to practice for PvP. The best damage perk is either Firing Line or Vorpal Weapon. Precision Instrument is great but you'll almost ever see the full benefits of it.
Masterworks: Reload Speed

I am glad Eye of Sol is back but if it is better than before will depend on how you view it. Snapshot Sights and Opening Shot in the same column still means those with the OG Eye of Sol are still winning. Moving Target is a great secondary, but there's one version I am really interested in.

Hammer-Forged Rifling / Accurized Rounds / Slickdraw / Snapshot Sights / Range MW / Alacrity / Targeting Adept Mod.

With this roll you'll have 100 range, 100 handling, and 88 aim assist. This will completely negate the loss from Slickdraw and feel incredible. I know my roll is a bit more niche, but if you do manage to get this, please let me know. I'd like to give it a try.
Masterworks: Handling

Masterworks: Handling

Falling Guillotine and its predecessor Dark-Drinker are some of my favorite swords. I still have my Guillotine and if it wasn't for the titan swords being so silly to run around with I'd still probably be using my Guillotine to this day. If you never got one from Arrivals or didn't get the roll you wanted, this is your time. Double damage perks in the third and fourth columns propell Falling Guillotine to the best sword in the game. Frenzy being a nice 15% damage buff with an additional 40% damage buff via surrounded on top gives Falling Guillotine the highest damage potential in the game. If you don't want to have to think about Surrounded being up and accidentally spinning too hard and deleting a few enemies from existence, you could go for a safer pick in Bait and Switch. You lose 5% in damage but make up for it in reliability. Another fun option which seems to be trending with the Brave Arsenal is the combination of Repulsor Brace and Destabilizing Rounds.

The curated roll of Falling Guillotine having the tried and true combo of Relentless Strikes and Whirlwind Blade gives a nice homage to the god roll of the past. It's still reliable but you're better off looking for a different "barrel" and "magazine."
Masterworks: Impact

In PvP we could see an uptick in sword usage. Falling Guillotine is the only sword in the game to get both Eager Edge and Chain Reaction, for you to zoom in and get a multikill off of one sword swing. I don't think there will be a better sword for PvP. Potentially the Half-Truths with the unique combination of Eager Edge and Tireless Blades for the best ammo efficiency.
Masterworks: Impact

While I, personally, am glad Forbearance is easier to get, I also understand why there's community hesitation against it. If you already have a Forbearance crafted or Adept, you definitely do not need to grind out the new version other than for progress towards Superblack. If you are like me and don't have Forbearance, you're just gonna grab the already tried and true roll of Ambitious Assassin and Chain Reaction. Unrelenting in column 3 is arguably better than Ambitious Assassin as it only takes 3 kills to activate and should work with Chain Reaction. If you're using the new Forbearance on a grenade heavy build this version could be better with the origin trait giving 5% grenade charge back.

Similarly to Unrelenting, Stats for All is on the curated roll. This allows you to massively bump up the handling and reload to 100, while also getting a 0.95x animation scalar. It's a very solid entry roll that will feed into itself with securing hits on the initial wave or with the explosions.
Masterworks: Velocity

Hitting 3 targets in PvE is certainly easier than hitting multiple targets in PvP. If you can make Stats for All work in PvP I will be impressed. A better perk would be Demolitionist for a total of 15% ability energy back on kills (10% paired with 5% from the origin trait), or Disruption Break to give your kinetic weapons a nice 50% damage boost. There isn't a lot to be said in column 4 for PvP as most Disruption Break grenade launchers are paired with Auto-Loading Holster in the third column. Wellspring could pair well with Demolitionist for even more ability energy, or Desperate Measures for a damage bonus without needing a weapon kill to start.
Masterworks: Velocity

Masterworks: Velocity

One of my favorite fusions as of late has been Loaded Question with Envious Assassin and Controlled Burst. Glacioclasm will have a similar roll but with Overflow. Both will allow you to destroy majors and bosses with ease.
Masterworks: Charge Time

Slideshot makes this roll. With Slideshot you can invest the rest of your stats into a mix of range and stability to still hit 100 range and have a whopping 76 stability. If you can somehow wrangle up full ammo you'll only sit 4 points less than 100 stability. High-Impact Reserves helps those long shots keep their damage at range.
Masterworks: Range

There has never been a more iconic legendary machine gun in Destiny 2 outside of Hammerhead. My old Feeding Frenzy and Rampage has been collecting dust but nothing else feels as good. The Brave version of Hammerhead can roll Rewind (WeeWoo) Rounds and Fourth Time's the Charm which will both refund ammo back into your magazine. Envious Assassin will allow you to overflow the magazine to over 200 if you also slot in a backup mag mod. Pair any of those perks will work wonderfully with your "damage" perk of choice. Onslaught will ramp up the RPM to 714, giving you incredible DPS. Killing Tally is one of the best damage perks for machine guns (and trace rifles). It doesn't go away until you reload which is where magazine extending perks like Rewind Rounds or Fourth Time's the Charm work well. Desperate Measures is the best of both worlds combining Adrenaline Junkie / Swashbuckler and Golden Tricorn.

The curated roll will be a great addition if you don't feel like futzing around and farming out multiple rolls. Armor-Piercing Rounds will allow some over-penetration to allow Killing Tally to ramp up easier. Fourth Time's the Charm also works well here as once you get to three stacks of Killing Tally you can lay into a boss and get a lot of the ammo back to delete most bosses and champions.
Masterworks: Range, Stability, Handling, Reload Speed

Over on the PvP side, machine guns haven't been high meta but they have always felt good. Hammerhead with Rewind Rounds and High-Impact Reserves will synergize well with the low ammo from the wall, and refund itself to get you a few more kills. If you wanted to really show some players their own ghosts you could instead opt for Onslaught to delete them at a blistering pace. Over-Under is another good shout here to get rid of most players in rifts. I wouldn't mind hearing more Hammerheads in the crucible. At least I'd know where they are.
Masterworks: Stability

Masterworks: Stability

Oh this is gonna be fun. I love a large mag and Cascade Point. My Until It's Return gets a lot of use due to being a better Fourth Horseman. This roll will get a ton of smiles clearing rooms and taking down beefier enemies with relative safety.
Masterworks: Velocity

While I don't think anyone will be vying for this roll in PvP I think the best use case is a swap build. Not ideal for "wasting" heavy to not get the kill with it. But being a wave frame you won't get a ton of direct hits to kill. If a guardian jumps it's all over. Ideal for pubs, not ideal for most PvP situations.
Masterworks: Velocity

This is one of the most feared scout rifles in all the land. This scout was made from the hides of Hive Gods-, what's that? This isn't a review on Touch of Malice? Okay let me start again.

Much like Gaelin-4 we can Yee to the Haw-, it's not Dead Man's Tale either? Shucks. What even is this? ... Hung jury, again? This is like the 8th time we've seen this weapon. Okay, let's hype it up.

Who is excited for Hung Jury SR4?! This Vanguard relic can certainly put rounds down range and take down far off targets with ease. If you missed getting your perfect roll in S14, S19, or S20. Well...this version takes some of the best perks and mushes them into one fabulous roll.

If you liked Explosive Payload and missed it on S14 and S19 you can grab that, or One for All that was only on S14's perk pool. Kinetic Tremors also moved to column 3 allowing you to stack two damage perks! Rewind Rounds might be better if you're using Hung Jury as your primary and taking down wave after wave of enemies, pair that with Firefly for AoE damage and you will seldom reload. If you liked some of the older perks like Adrenaline Junkie you'll be better off keeping your older version.
Masterworks: Stability

The curated roll comes with Enlightened Action and Box Breathing. Box Breathing has lost its place ever since its big nerf back in season 3. This roll does allow some crispy 3-taps within PvP for a 0.67s TtK. Enlightened Action will just bring up the low handling and make the weapon feel better as you hit targets.

Speaking of the crucible the curated roll is almost perfect, if you don't like Enlightened Action you could instead opt for No Distractions or Rapid Hit. Both make subsequent shots easier to hit so you can achieve that blistering fast TtK. If you don't like the "gimmick" of Box Breathing you could try and farm our rolls with Explosive Payload or Cascade Point. The former adding extra flinch, the latter dropping the TtK to 0.60s but still requiring 3 crits and 1 body shot.
Masterworks: Stability

The former adding extra flinch, the latter dropping the TtK to 0.60s but still requiring 3 crits and 1 body shot.
Masterworks: Stability

Imperative returns to us in a different form. No longer is it covered in leaves! -- what's that? It's still covered in leaves? Heck.
Most of us already have. Workhorse PvE scout. If this is your first season playing destiny either as a new light or a returning player, Imperative has one great redeeming factor; damage. Imperative belongs to the high-impact archetype of scouts giving it the slowest firing rate but the highest damage. Pairing that with more damage through Adrenaline Junkie, some AoE damage through Kinetic Tremors or Explosive Payload. All of these will be happily paired with Rapid Hit for the bonuses to the low stability and reload speed. Subsistence and Keep Away both mitigate the low reload speed by bypassing reload entirely or speeding it up, respectively. I'd still recommend Rapid Hit over both as missing a shot is extremely unforgiving with the slower rate of fire. Precision hits are going to be the goal, why not make follow up shot easier while we're at it.
Masterworks: Handling
Masterworks: Stability

Incisor is an exotic trace rifle in legendary form. Envious Assassin or Subsistence to keep the magazine topped up to keep fueling Killing Tally will open up your loadouts for a ton of other weapons. Kill Clip is a bit easier to keep track of, but it isn't nearly as strong. The only other competition Incisor has is Appetence which even then they aren't perfectly comparable as one is Strand and the other is Stasis, so you might not even use them for the same purposes or with the same loadouts. Definitely pick this up this season.
Masterworks: Handling

Trace rifles in general are not the strongest picks for PvP. Dynamic Sway Reduction and Tap the Trigger double dip in consistency perks, which you will need as the ammo economy is incredibly unforgiving. If you can manage to scrounge enough ammo for sprees then I would love to see the blistering 0.6s time to kill with Kill Clip.
Masterworks: Range

Masterworks: Range

This sidearm is the reason why this breakdown took so long. I cannot wrap my head around it and it took me a while to get rolls I wanted to test. Beacon Rounds are incredible, it turns into a mini-tracking rocket. A beefier Dreg's Promise if you remember. Impulse Amplifier gives you a near hit scan weapon. Voltshot turns Indebted Kindness into a pocket Trinity Ghoul with a beefier per shot damage profile.
Masterworks: Velocity

Indebted Kindness is extremely interesting in the crucible. Impulse Amplifier can turn this into a near instant pseudo-grenade launcher shot, but I think most players are going to opt for Beacon Rounds for better tracking and hip-fire usage. The tracking isn't incredible side to side, for when a Dawnblade flies across your screen, but for general strafing the tracking at low levels is great. At higher buffs you can start to get into a groove and be a bit more loose with your aim, but I wouldn't rely heavily on the tracking. Adagio makes Indebted Kindness a reliable two shot, which I think feeds well into Beacon Rounds.
Masterworks: Velocity

Judgment got an upgrade going from Kinetic to Stasis. While now it competes with the very dominant and popular Eyasluna, both being from a dungeon makes the competition also even. Headstone also being in the third column gives Judgment a huge edge. Being able to rock a damage perk and Headstone elevate Judgement past Eyasluna, however, Eyasluna is also able to get Unrelenting for better health. To each their own, but that is what makes Destiny so great.
Masterworks: Reload Speed

Judgment lost a little bit of its edge in the crucible. You can still get Slideshot and Opening Shot. It's not that Judgment is bad, just that other weapons edged it out and 140's aren't exactly strong in this meta (for the first time in a while). Hitmark HCS, SteadyHand HCS, or FastDraw HCS are all great options and allow you to add some much needed stats and aim assist. I am surprised Bungie didn't swap Judgment over to barrels. I guess hand cannon sights are easier than "sights" if that makes sense.
Masterworks: Range, Stability

Lethal Abundance has one thing going for it, being a Strand high-impact frame auto rifle. Slice and Hatchling both give this weapon extra Strand utility, but on other subclasses this weapon feels like any generic high-impact auto rifle. Enlightened Action and Keep Away both bump up your reload speed, either organically or passively, respectively. Target Lock works best on beefier targets, but can also help on rank and file enemies. Hatchling works best when paired with Strand. Onslaught might be the best neutral perk, but if you want a faster firing auto rifle, just use any of the other Strand auto.
Masterworks: Handling

Lethal Abundance might have a better place in PvP with great neutral buffs like Tap the Trigger paired with Keep Away. Dynamic Sway Reduction can also tighten up the firing pattern. Slice is looking like the best option for most players in the third column, so having a bit of added stability or better lethality will depend on the players.
Masterworks: Stability

Lethophobia is defined as an abnormal anxiety of forgetting. Let's hope you don't forget the god rolls of this bow then. As with most PvE bows you're looking for a good combination of draw time and accuracy. Successful Warm-Up gives you a better draw time post-defeat, but has a bit less utility against higher health enemies. Explosive Head can stagger those arrow sponges a bit easier but having Rapid Hit or Archer's Tempo there would have been preferred. Disruption break will work best in conjunction with a high damage kinetic weapon like this season's Supercluster slug shotgun. Golden Tricorn will feel great on a combination of subclasses this season with Permeability changing this weapons damage type from void to your selected subclass. You can run a full void or full strand or stasis loadout without much thought. Just remember that the damage change goes away when you stow this weapon.
Masterworks: Draw Time

Lethophobia is already making a strong impression on crucible players everywhere being the first bow to roll Disruption Break. Paired with any kinetic weapon you can city shot and get a whopping 50% extra damage on any kinetic weapon from you or anyone on your team. This damage debuff stays applied for a full 5.5 seconds. Be on the lookout for the "Disrupted" debuff off your screen, you will be extra vulnerable for this time.
Masterworks: Accuracy

Luna's Howl is back and retains its precision frame, while firing at 140 RPM. If you don't have a good Zaouli's Bane or Igneous Hammer with Heal Clip this can substitute. There's no shortage of Incandescent hand cannons. Magnificent Howl changed from needing precision hits to precision kills, this paired with Lucky Pants can dish out incredible damage, and fan refund itself. It could be very good and fun for lower end PvE content.

The curated roll of Luna's Howl is a great starting point for both PvE and PvP. Eye of the Storm grants accuracy and the aforementioned Magnificent Howl putting in work in low end PvE. As you scale up you might want something like Precision Instrument or Desperate Measures but it won't carry you through a grandmaster nightfall.
Masterworks: Stability

I am most excited to use Luna's Howl in the crucible. Precision Instrument doesn't allow you to 2c1b 10 resilience but will allow you to get some lower resilience players. You will want to invest some points into range to really help out the low base range. Magnificent Howl does allow for some fun two taps and blinting moments to keep the chaining going.
Masterworks: Range

Luna's Howl is back and retains its precision frame, while firing at 140 RPM. If you don't have a good Zaouli's Bane or Igneous Hammer with Heal Clip this can substitute. There's no shortage of Incandescent hand cannons. Magnificent Howl changed from needing precision hits to precision kills, this paired with Lucky Pants can dish out incredible damage, and fan refund itself. It could be very good and fun for lower end PvE content.

As you scale up you might want something like Precision Instrument or Desperate Measures but it won't carry you through a grandmaster nightfall.
Masterworks: Stability

I am most excited to use Luna's Howl in the crucible. Precision Instrument doesn't allow you to 2c1b 10 resilience but will allow you to get some lower resilience players. You will want to invest some points into range to really help out the low base range. Magnificent Howl does allow for some fun two taps and blinting moments to keep the chaining going.
Masterworks: Range

I'm happy to see more adaptive frame machine guns. None will ever replace our lord and savior Hammerhead. But we can think they're still strong in our heart of hearts. Onslaught paired with Triple Tap could be really good for about 3 seconds. You will have to ramp up the kills with some smaller enemies, hoping not to waste too much ammo, and then unload into a major or boss with the added damage with the remainder of your magazine. In practice I don't know how well it will be. Golden Tricorn can activate, reload, and then you can ramp up to the second level with a full magazine.
Masterworks: Stability

In PvP the added damage from Golden Tricorn 1x will allow for some blistering fast kills, Threat Detector will make this machine gun feel more like a submachine gun in CQC but will not have those added benefits in its intended ranges. Demolitionist and Slice both offer unique benefits.
Masterworks: Range

Midnight Coup is still my most used weapon of all time in PvE. I float around too much to stick with one weapon. I almost dethroned the King with Austringer back in Season of Opulence, but the King still stands tall. The newest version seeks the throne from the prototype and I'm looking to get a nice Holo-foil roll with double perks to really get the best of all worlds. Firefly is arguably the best perk in the third column as it provides AoE damage, and a reload speed bump. This way you won't have to spec into reload at all as the base 56 gets brought up to 100 with Firefly. Explosive Payload is also a flat damage increase in PvE and helps with stunning champions when Hand Cannon mods are up. Finally we have Shoot to Loot, this coupled with the next perk in column 4 can pick up orbs and ammo from across the map.

That specific perk is Kinetic Tremors. Kinetic Tremors will activate after 6 shots, which will most likely happen against bosses, champions, or majors. If you wanted a more "on demand" perk, you could choose One for All which has the potential to ramp up after just one well timed and placed crit, knock out 3 enemies and you've got a 35% damage increase. The final perk you should at least try is Desperate Measures, it works with any ability build and allows you to flex between Swashbuckler / Adrenaline Junkie and Golden Tricorn; it isn't as build specific as the former two, and it is refreshable unlike the latter.

Let's briefly talk about the curated roll. Midnight Coup's curated roll is Smallbore / Accurized / Outlaw / Kinetic Tremors. This is a nice glow up from the Outlaw / Rampage roll. If you were to get this roll the only downside in PvE would be the magazine and possibly Outlaw. I believe this roll works best in PvE content as that is what made Midnight Coup the legend that it is today.
Masterworks: Reload Speed

If you were to take a roll into the Crucible, I would recommend Moving Target or Explosive Payload in the third column. Especially now that Explosive Payload has been brought back up to not have a resilience check. Moving Target will bring Midnight Coup to a nice even 100 aim assist, the only other gun to achieve this is Eyasluna with Moving Target, any sight, and a targeting adjustor. Pair this with Zen Moment or Opening Shot and you'll have an incredibly strong dueling weapon. Zen Moment makes subsequent shots easier by increasing your flinch resistance, and Opening Shot starting the duel out on the best possible foot. Midnight Coup suffers from below average range, so I would recommend Hammer-Forged Rifling to bring that up, with Zen Moment you won't need to worry about stability as much, but I would stay away from dropping any stats with Full Bore.
Masterworks: Range, Stability

I almost dethroned the King with Austringer back in Season of Opulence, but the King still stands tall. The newest version seeks the throne from the prototype and I'm looking to get a nice Holo-foil roll with double perks to really get the best of all worlds. If you were to get this roll the only downside in PvE would be the magazine and possibly Outlaw. If you were to take a roll into the Crucible, I would recommend Moving Target or Explosive Payload in the third column. Especially now that Explosive Payload has been brought back up to not have a resilience check. Moving Target will bring Midnight Coup to a nice even 100 aim assist, the only other gun to achieve this is Eyasluna with Moving Target, any sight, and a targeting adjustor. Pair this with Zen Moment or Opening Shot and you'll have an incredibly strong dueling weapon. Zen Moment makes subsequent shots easier by increasing your flinch resistance, and Opening Shot starting the duel out on the best possible foot. Midnight Coup suffers from below average range, so I would recommend Hammer-Forged Rifling to bring that up, with Zen Moment you won't need to worry about stability as much, but I would stay away from dropping any stats with Full Bore.
Masterworks: Range, Stability

How do we feel about lightweight submachine guns in PvE content? Well, if it's not named CALUS Mini-Tool, I don't think they are the best option. Multimach is no exception. Frenzy will give you the easiest damage bonus and increase our reload speed. Target Lock and Kinetic Tremors will both have utility in PvE activities, but won't have as much utility without a reload perk in column 3.
Masterworks: Reload Speed

Multimach is back and boy do I have conflicting views on this. Should we invest in lethality or consistency? Iron Reach will be incredible in 3v3 game modes, as well as Trials and potentially in Rumble, but Kill Clip will be even better for 6v6 game modes or slayers. Ideally you'll find a healthy mix of range and stability, but Dynamic Sway Reduction will cover most of your stability if you opt for Iron Reach. If you prefer Kill Clip, then I would recommend Moving Target for better movement speed and being that quick slayer we all know you are.
Masterworks: Range, Stability

Naren's Lance is an interesting weapon. It's not quite dead on arrival, but it doesn't do any one thing particularly well. Reconstruction and Precision Instrument are great paired with the rapid fire frame, allowing a ton of shots fired with increased damage. But then it falls in that it's a rapid fire frame and firing at 140 RPM while maintaining full crits is extremely difficult.
Masterworks: Reload Speed

Over in the crucible it also lags behind without two of the most important perks. Opening Shot or Snapshot Sights, and while you can get away without either of those perks and still see success, you'll have to find handling and accuracy perks elsewhere. Keep Away is fantastic for reducing your accuracy cone, and Elemental Capacitor could bump you up to 100 handling with an arc subclass. I don't think many players will opt for this sniper but you can make it work.
Masterworks: Handling

Precision frame hand cannons have not had their time in the spotlight for a while. Outside of the Seventh Seraph Officer's Revolver paired with Lucky Pants there are not many reasons to use a precision frame hand cannon. If you run void subclasses a lot you can take advantage of Golden Tricorn to maximize damage, making these fast firing hand cannons feel way more chunky than they normally are. Rapid Hit will also bring up the already decent reload speed and their exceptional stability. If you feel like you need more range in PvE (which is an already odd thing to task for) you can opt for Keep Away for a continuous reload speed buff and a touch more range.
Masterworks: Handling

Keep Away is stronger in the crucible where range matters far more. Kill Clip gives you nostalgia for the Not Forgotten or Luna's Howl days of yore with a 0.67 time to kill. You are put in a time constraint which some players might not like, but in 6v6 game modes it's not too hard to find another unwilling participant. Fully invested into range your Optative can reach out to 34.66 meters, for the record that is further by over 1 meter than catalyzed Thorn. The drawback is the lower 1.0 s TtK but once you get going with the 0.67 TtK you can destroy any Thorn user. (Food for thought).
Masterworks: Range

I remember the OG quest for Outbreak Prime. What a fun time. Outbreak Perfected has truly been perfected with crafting. Arrowhead Brake does improve the recoil but Outbreak Perfected has "auto rifle" recoil making the bounce a lot less intense. Bumping up the magazine with Appended Mag or Tactical Mag is preferred for more shots, but Flared Magwell for a bump in stability and reload will also feel nice. Rewind Rounds is the best perk in slot especially if the nanites count towards the bullets back. Rapid Hit or Outlaw are also great for just adding stability and reload. Short-Action Stock brings up the handling.
Masterworks:

If you would like to bring the nanites into PvP I would opt for one of two ways. Arrowhead Brake at the front end for added recoil direction, Accurized Rounds for the extra range. Headseeker or Rapid Hit depending on what you value, and your choice of Short-Action Stock for more handling or Hand-Laid Stock for the most stability. The alternative way is with Fitted Stock to bring you right up to 100 recoil direction meaning you can slot in Smallbore or even Hammer-Forged Rifling for more range. You drop some handling unless you make that up in your barrel.
Masterworks:

Parabellum is the Exit Strategy I wish I had. Enlightened Action will buff the weapon feel before Frenzy kicks in or against before targets. Rewind Rounds are fantastic for mowing down wave after wave of enemies. I'd say that Parabellum is a workhorse weapon but it's just not as strong as the CALUS-Mini Tool for being a solar submachine gun, and the competition for being a submachine gun in PvE gets stronger and stronger each season.
Masterworks: Stability

Adaptive frame submachine guns are my favorite in PvP. They combine a good weapon feel with good damage too. The Hero's Burden is amazing with Kill Clip. Parabellum gets two damage perks both with different feels. Adagio will give you forgiveness and keep your time to kill relatively the same. If you can activate Frenzy you'll drop your time to kill down to a blistering 0.67s but you'll have to keep Frenzy up in order to maintain that momentum. I have a difficult time playing the mini game of "Frenzy."
Masterworks: Range

Dragonfly and Voltshot is an incredibly unique combination. Dragonfly doesn't extend the Voltshot radius, but extra boom and zap does clear a room faster than one or the other. If you're looking for a more neutral weapon, I'd say that Rewind Rounds and Target Lock will be your best options for taking down majors with ease. Prosecutor isn't ideal for PvE, but we're all here for the PvP review.
Masterworks: Reload Speed

We're in an auto rifle meta. Prosecutor is leading part of the charge. Target Lock in combination with Keep Away or Zen Moment makes for an extremely lethal and consistent weapon. You can almost ignore everything else if you have these two perks.
Masterworks: Range

Relentless could overthrow Messenger for being the best legendary high-impact pulse in the game. Is it definitively better? No, nothing really is in this game. But it can compete for sure. Rapid Hit and Desperado are both great perks. Relentless being Strand allows it Slice and Hatchling that Messenger cannot get. Frenzy and Keep Away are both neutral perks that could do well with just about any combination of alternate perks.
Masterworks: Reload Speed

In PvP Relentless and Messenger really stand toe to toe. Neither are exceptionally better than the other, and both come with Rapid Hit and Headseeker or Keep Away. Zen Moment really shines on Relentless and possibly puts it over the edge. Whichever way you fall on the two pulses both will serve you extremely well.
Masterworks: Stability

Retold Tale is not a PvE shotgun. It does come with some nice PvE perks like One-Two Punch, but the lack of Grave Robber lowers it in my opinion. Destabilizing Rounds and Repulsor Brace have good synergy but on a shotgun I'd rather take a good damage perk over an add clearing one.
Masterworks: Reload Speed

Retold Tale was and still is one of my favorite shotguns. I used it a ton before getting my best Mindbender's Ambition. I still prefer the U shaped sights on Retold. I grinded out a decent Compass Rose with QuickDraw and Snapshot Sights, so we will see if Retold will be better. I think most players will still opt for a Matador but having a super snappy shotgun won't hurt your vault space too much (though seeing the state of your vault it might be a tough squeeze /s).
Masterworks: Handling, Range

Retrofuturist is an interesting addition this season. Alongside Riiswalker we have a kinetic option for a lightweight frame shotgun. Retrofuturist was never a truly strong pick for PvE and that remains for this current version. Auto-Loading Holster will be your best quality of life perk, and paired with Vorpal Weapon is a very cookie-cutter shotgun. Destabilizing Rounds pairs best with Feeding Frenzy to use Retrofuturist as your primary add-clearing weapon.
Masterworks: Reload Speed

If you like snappy shotguns you will be happy to learn that Retrofuturist gets access to Quickdraw and Snapshot Sights. I prefer Slickdraw as shotgun aim assist doesn't feel incredibly strong to me, but I also don't mind lower AA weapons in general. Having a fast shotgun is more important to me, your mileage may vary with that. I think most players will opt for the tried and true Quickdraw and Snapshot Sights.
Masterworks: Range

Riiswalker is an interesting weapon. A Fallen-forged weapon that can be used against the Fallen. Oh how the turns have tabled. Discord and Vorpal Weapon are going to be my top picks for keeping your magazine loaded and for extra damage against majors. It will not be better than more defined picks, but it will be strong in less focused strikes and low-end PvE.
Masterworks: Reload Speed

If you never grinded out your Wastelander patterns like me, this could be your next best option. Riiswalker was always my favorite lightweight shotgun and this version comes with the same great stat package with a potential 100 range. The one thing that separated it from Wastelander was the lack of Opening Shot, this version comes with Opening Shot, and Slideshot for the coveted 100 range. With all the investments into range your barrel and masterwork should be geared towards handling.
Masterworks: Range, Handling

Ros Arago IV is a great new option for those of us who don't like or never got a good Gnawing Hunger. Ros Arago IV has a few tricks up its sleeve that even propel it over a good Gnawing Hunger like the addition of Golden Tricorn for damage; Rewind Rounds for slightly better magazine efficiency; Repulsor Brace for better subclass synergy; Onslaught for better DPS against higher health enemies. Depending on your needs, Ros Arago IV could even be your one and done void auto rifle.
Masterworks: Stability

Over in the crucible it is slightly better and slightly worse than Gnawing Hunger. Instead of getting bonus damage through Kill Clip you can decrease your time to kill via Onslaught. With arguably a better accuracy perk in Dynamic Sway Reduction over Zen Moment. It ultimately will depend on which model you prefer as well as which version you'd like. Both technically have time to kill reducing post-kill perks as well as accuracy boosting perks.
Masterworks: Range

I hope that Scalar Potential lives up to its name. An arc rapid-fire frame Feels. Very. Familiar. Huh, I can't place my thumb on it. Well, since we've never seen one of these before you're going to want Overflow to double your magazine capacity, and Golden Tricorn to really pump up that damage. Arrowhead Brake is almost required for the low 53 recoil direction. With our new deterministic recoil you might be able to learn the recoil pattern and not need Arrowhead Brake, but I don't like to fight with my weapons.
Masterworks: Stability

Scalar Potential doesn't reinvent the wheel. The perks unique to it aren't useful in the crucible spare Enlightened Action which will make this pulse feel better but not help its lethality. Neutrally with Headseeker you could have a pulse that feels fantastic, but Keep Away will probably be better for the range and accuracy bonuses. If you like the model and sights I'd suggest grinding out the patterns, if you already have another rapid-fire frame pulse I wouldn't worry too much about this one.
Masterworks: Stability

Oh hey, a new strand fusion rifle. Will Scatter Signal be better than Pressurized Precision? Well neither are great as Strand fusion rifles. But for a "Kinetic" fusion rifle I think Scatter Signal rivals and possibly beats out Riptide for best in slot fusion. Overflow and Controlled Burst for added damage throughout the magazine. You'll only need one magazine booster to hit the fusion cap of 8 shots or you can opt for an even faster firing fusion with Accelerated Coils. Overflow will double your magazine capacity giving you 16 shots, 15 of which will have an extra 20% damage increase. If you opt for Extended Battery for the 16 total shots you can slot in Major or Boss spec for an additional 7.77% damage to every shot.
Masterworks: Charge Time

In PvP there's not a lot that can convince me that rapid-fire frame fusion rifles are anything other than anti-shotgun weapons. The "Uno Reverse" of the Destiny weapons. Scatter Signal doesn't really lean into the anti-ape role but it does have a few tricks up its metaphorical sleeve in Kickstart for the most ape fusion we can get. Lower the charge time as low as it can go or just throw on Kickstart for extra damage and speedier shots. I'd pair that with Perpetual Motion for the bonuses to stability and handling. This way the rest of your perks can be invested into range.
Masterworks: Range

Sleepless is an interesting rocket. It was great when rockets could be used everywhere and when we didn't have to reload via Lunafaction Boots or Rally Barricades. Currently you'll find very limited uses out of most rockets. There are a few options that have risen to the top, but it means most rockets are going to fall into general utility tools. Sleepless has Chain Reaction for better add clear, and Auto-Loading Holster for quality of life. You might be able to squeeze out some solid DPS with Field Prep but without a good damage perk you'll fall behind almost immediately.
Masterworks: Velocity

Crucible rockets need one thing, a great blast radius. Sleepless has that in droves. With a blast radius masterwork you'll sit at 100 even, that way you can invest your other perks into velocity and handling, bringing up some of its lower stats. With Quick Launch and High-Velocity Rounds you're looking at a nice 60 velocity. It won't beat Impulse Amplifier for the quickest rocket but it will move. Chain Reaction then becomes great for dealing with multiple guardians in every gamemode.
Masterworks: Velocity

Stay Frosty is a bit of an odd weapon. It lost a bit of utility from last years model, but gained a quality of life perk in Enlightened Action. Desperado is a fun perk but nothing about this weapon will break the meta or shake up the game.
Masterworks: Stability

There are two versions of this weapon you can get. Don't take into MnK or controller as seriously. The MnK roll is better for 6v6 or slaying play styles. The controller roll is better for 3v3 or more neutral play styles. Both will feel great but have different utilities.
Masterworks: Stability

Subjunctive was the smg that could. It felt great in PvE and held its own back when recluse dominated all aspects of our life. Oh how naive we were. When Rampage and Outlaw were all we cared about. Things have shifted and more weapons are certainly popular. The only true competition Subjunctive needs to worry about is the Ikelos SMG. Both are arc, but what gives Subjunctive the edge? Golden Tricorn. It's not the highest uptime on Arc but you can chain back to back arc ability kills with some loadouts, this will give Subjunctive a 1.5x damage bonus over the Ikelos (this is without giving the Ikelos a damage perk of its own). Most players spec'ed into Voltshot which will clear rooms easier but have slight difficulties taking down beefier targets. With Golden Tricorn 2x you'll have enough damage to look at enemies and they'll become unalive from sheer admiration, and you'll be able to chunk down majors with ease, Subsistence just keeps the chains rolling.
Masterworks: Stability

Subjunctive in PvP is a bit more subjective. Being a lightweight frame without any large range extending perks puts Subjunctive lower on the list of best SMGs within Shadx's playhouse. Threat detector helps boost your stats within range, and Swashbuckler can help your next engagement when you ultimately melee your opponent dead.
Masterworks: Range

I understand Bungie wants players to get a taste of the raid weapons to get players to buy the expansions and then play the raids, but Heritage is arguably a better Deep Stone Crypt weapon that doesn't infringe on other weapon types. Nevertheless, there are not many rolls you will be farming for. Reconstruction will give you more ammo in your magazine by rebuilding itself over time. Pair that with either Vorpal Weapon or Recombination for some high damage shot(s). Firing Line is great if you can link up with teammates to get the extra damage.

Succession's curated roll comes with Lead from Gold and Focused Fury. Focused Fury is a great damage perk that ramps up as you continuously fire (and hit). Lead From Gold is a bit underwhelming as there is a better perk in the same column but I understand Bungie's philosophy of 80% of a god roll.
Masterworks: Handling, Stability

Over in the crucible snipers have taken a hit. Not only did they get harder to use with an aim assist nerf, but the ammo economy shifting makes it feel as if you're never getting ammo. In order to make the most use of Succession you'll need high handling alongside Snapshot Sights. Then you can choose your column 3 perk from Moving Target for added aim assist and strafe speed when ADS, or Firmly Planted for better accuracy and a slight handling bump when crouched.
Masterworks: Handling

I understand Bungie wants players to get a taste of the raid weapons to get players to buy the expansions and then play the raids, but Heritage is arguably a better Deep Stone Crypt weapon that doesn't infringe on other weapon types. Nevertheless, there are not many rolls you will be farming for. Reconstruction will give you more ammo in your magazine by rebuilding itself over time. Pair that with either Vorpal Weapon or Recombination for some high damage shot(s). Firing Line is great if you can link up with teammates to get the extra damage.

Succession's curated roll comes with Lead from Gold and Focused Fury. Focused Fury is a great damage perk that ramps up as you continuously fire (and hit). Lead From Gold is a bit underwhelming as there is a better perk in the same column but I understand Bungie's philosophy of 80% of a god roll.
Masterworks: Handling, Stability

Over in the crucible snipers have taken a hit. Not only did they get harder to use with an aim assist nerf, but the ammo economy shifting makes it feel as if you're never getting ammo. In order to make the most use of Succession you'll need high handling alongside Snapshot Sights. Then you can choose your column 3 perk from Moving Target for added aim assist and strafe speed when ADS, or Firmly Planted for better accuracy and a slight handling bump when crouched.
Masterworks: Handling

Does Heritage have some competition? I love to see it. Reconstruction on a non-raid weapon paired with Vorpal Weapon for consistent damage throughout the larger mag is going to be your go-to. Enhanced Cascade Point could be funny. I love it on my Until It's Return as a mini-Fourth Horseman. Oh wow, we are like 3 layers deep. Personally I'd take Assault Mag for the boost to RPM in getting out those shots faster, but it's not necessary.
Masterworks: Handling

Slug shotguns are not nearly as dominant as they used to be. They used to be a high skill, high reward weapon that prioritized good aim for in return a deep OHK. Threat Detector and Fragile Focus both boost your already good range and handling. That's really all you're going to need. Invest the rest of your stats into whatever you feel like you'll need more. Handling outside of Threat Detector range or range for when your shields are broken.
Masterworks: Range

We all probably have a scout in our vault we use for PvE. Do we need another? Well technically no. Taraxippos doesn't do anything another scout couldn't do equally or better. If you somehow don't have one, then yeah. Grind yourself one out this Guardian Games. It's easy to get and you'll probably have more than you know what to do with.
Masterworks: Reload Speed

With the update to scout rifle damage, I think there's a good case for this scout being a low-key meta choice. It won't have as good of a feeling as the rapid-fire frames, nor the oomph of the high-impacts. But the extra movement speed and the extra flexibility could aid certain builds and loadouts. I love kill clip for really deleting guardians in 6s, but it falls off hard in 3s.
Masterworks: Stability

Mountaintop will always have a love/hate relationship for the player base. Not only was it incredibly strong in PvP being able to nuke a player from across the map, but it also had a long-standing history in PvE being able to destroy majors and auto-reload via Lunafaction Boots / Rally Barricades. Nowadays the combo is a lot less potent.

We can still make Mountaintop into a formidable weapon and certainly one to chase. Ambitious Assassin allows up to two shots per magazine after a kill, if you were to pair that with Frenzy for 100 reload you could use this for back to back firing against a boss. The added 15% damage boost won't hurt either. Vorpal weapon is another flat 15% damage boost. The best bang for your shot is Recombination. This gives you a 100% damage increase for any 10 elemental weapon kills. If you ever wanted Izanagi's Burden in the form of a grenade launcher, Recombination paired with Auto-Loading Holster will be the roll to grab.

The curated Mountaintop is an interesting roll. Lead From Gold allows you to rock out with a heavy weapon and run double specials. One for All is an easy damage bonus to grab with grenade launchers as the splash damage can hit multiple enemies. There are certainly better perk combos for a double special loadout and even if you wanted to rock One for All, I'd recommend Ambitious Assassin or Overflow to make it easier to use.
Masterworks: Velocity

Mountaintop originally didn't have much of a footing in PvP but quickly dove right into our nightmares. If you want a quick-swap roll go for Slickdraw. If you want more of a long ranged tube shotgun roll, Impulse Amplifier will make the grenade shot near instant. With the way special ammo is shaking up in the crucible through the meter or boxes, I think some of the best perks for Mountaintop are the swap perks, Harmony and Recombination. Both allow you to build up a higher damage shot to make Mountaintop one shot again, bringing it back to Recluse or another Harmony weapon to flex on all the hunters out there.
Masterworks: Velocity

Mountaintop will always have a love/hate relationship for the player base. Not only was it incredibly strong in PvP being able to nuke a player from across the map, but it also had a long-standing history in PvE being able to destroy majors and auto-reload via Lunafaction Boots / Rally Barricades. Nowadays the combo is a lot less potent.

We can still make Mountaintop into a formidable weapon and certainly one to chase. Ambitious Assassin allows up to two shots per magazine after a kill, if you were to pair that with Frenzy for 100 reload you could use this for back to back firing against a boss. The added 15% damage boost won't hurt either. Vorpal weapon is another flat 15% damage boost. The best bang for your shot is Recombination. This gives you a 100% damage increase for any 10 elemental weapon kills. If you ever wanted Izanagi's Burden in the form of a grenade launcher, Recombination paired with Auto-Loading Holster will be the roll to grab.

The curated Mountaintop is an interesting roll. Lead From Gold allows you to rock out with a heavy weapon and run double specials. One for All is an easy damage bonus to grab with grenade launchers as the splash damage can hit multiple enemies. There are certainly better perk combos for a double special loadout and even if you wanted to rock One for All, I'd recommend Ambitious Assassin or Overflow to make it easier to use.
Masterworks: Velocity

Mountaintop originally didn't have much of a footing in PvP but quickly dove right into our nightmares. If you want a quick-swap roll go for Slickdraw. If you want more of a long ranged tube shotgun roll, Impulse Amplifier will make the grenade shot near instant. With the way special ammo is shaking up in the crucible through the meter or boxes, I think some of the best perks for Mountaintop are the swap perks, Harmony and Recombination. Both allow you to build up a higher damage shot to make Mountaintop one shot again, bringing it back to Recluse or another Harmony weapon to flex on all the hunters out there.
Masterworks: Velocity

New DMT-lite? Heck yeah. Let's Yee to the Haw. Keep Away will benefit your accuracy and reload speed which will help alleviate the necessity of reloader gauntlets. Do I recommend foregoing it entirely? No but you can stack enough reload through your masterwork, Keep Away, and Tactical Mag or Flared Magwell to not need it. Precision Instrument will be great as the reload will allow you to keep up high stacks. Headstone works will being a scout and a high-damage frame.
Masterworks: Reload Speed

The Prophet in PvP doesn't really handle like a legendary DMT; more like a long ranged 120 hand cannon. Precision Instrument will make the 2c1b a little easier, but Kill Clip will be the most sought after perk for being able to 2c any resilience guardian. 120 hand cannons lost this ability so if you're looking for a replacement, this is it.
Masterworks: Stability

Do I recommend foregoing it entirely? No but you can stack enough reload through your masterwork, Keep Away, and Tactical Mag or Flared Magwell to not need it. Precision Instrument will be great as the reload will allow you to keep up high stacks. Headstone works will being a scout and a high-damage frame.
Masterworks: Reload Speed

The Prophet in PvP doesn't really handle like a legendary DMT; more like a long ranged 120 hand cannon. Precision Instrument will make the 2c1b a little easier, but Kill Clip will be the most sought after perk for being able to 2c any resilience guardian. 120 hand cannons lost this ability so if you're looking for a replacement, this is it.
Masterworks: Stability

Recluse has not only been power crept from its former self with things like Funnelweb, IKELOS_SMG_v1.0.3, CALUS Mini-Tool, and even The Title from the recent Guardian Games. Did we know The Recluse was coming back to take its throne? Not at the time. But we can say for certain it's here to stay. Subsistence, Enlightened Action, or Feeding Frenzy are all great perks to maximize the reload or bypass having to reload one way or another. Repulsor Brace is incredible with Void subclasses, but you don't need to be on Void to take advantage of this SMG. Desperate Measures can work on any subclass and has great synergy with any of the reload perks. Obviously a damage + reload combo will be good but having something that doesn't necessarily lean into any of the subclass verbs can make it easier to translate across builds and activities. Would you be better with a more subclass focused roll? Highly depends on your build.

The curated roll of Recluse is a carbon copy of the original, so if you liked the original you'll like the curated roll. Nothing new to decipher here.
Masterworks: Stability

Recluse's defining trait, Master of Arms, being brought down to a 15% damage buff makes it more manageable as a weapon and less dominant in PvE and PvP. Instead you could opt for consistency perks like Dynamic Sway Reduction, or Tap the Trigger. Threat Detector and Hip-Fire Grip are both excellent but have more limiting use cases; distance and non-ADS respectively. Desperate Measures is a better lethality perk as it can activate while stowed, so once you get a grenade or melee kill it lets you relive the 20% damage bonus of pre-nerf Master of Arms.
Masterworks: Range

New sword? I am pretty excited for the Slammer. Being a Zoom sword with some interesting combos means it will most likely find itself in my loadouts. Eager Edge will be great for most players, but if you're looking for maximum damage I would recommend Relentless Strikes for ammo back. Chain Reaction and Thresh are also great options with some of the fourth column perks. Bait and Switch will be the best for pure damage, but Cold Steel for Stasis synergy and helping with champions might be a great play.
Masterworks: Impact

I do not think The Slammer will be the best PvP option for Swords, truly if you're looking for a Zoom sword Half-Truths is the best being paired with Tireless Blade for the best ammo economy. Obviously the Other Half is a "flex" as will an adept Slammer, but you and I both know you could have styled on one more player with Half-Truths.
Masterworks: Impact

Obviously the Other Half is a "flex" as will an adept Slammer, but you and I both know you could have styled on one more player with Half-Truths.
Masterworks: Impact

The Summoner in PvE has a few different options. You can opt for a Heal Clip roll to keep yourself alive, a Target Lock roll to take down champions and larger health enemies, or even an Onslaught roll to tear into waves of adds with the damage of an auto but the speed of an SMG. Take your pick. If you're going Heal Clip I would recommend Incandescent. Target Lock will work best with Overflow and Onslaught with Subsistence. You can mix and match to your heart's content, but those are my recommendations.
Masterworks: Reload Speed

PvP has far less options but still some solid options. Instead of different niches within the grand scheme of PvE content, we really have consistency or lethality 2x. Within both you'll find a healthy scoop of stability perks, either Zen Moment, Dynamic Sway Reduction, or Perpetual Motion. Pick your poison there. If you want more consistency on top of your consistency sundae, go for Tap the Trigger. For lethality you can opt for Target Lock, Onslaught, or the tried and true Kill Clip. All options are great but work in different ways, your best option might not be the same as others so give them a try.
Masterworks: Range

All options are great but work in different ways, your best option might not be the same as others so give them a try.
Masterworks: Range

Void mains rejoice. I don't think anyone is surprised to see this pick. Smallbore plus ricochet rounds boosts your stability and range enough to not worry about engagement ranges and compete with auto rifles. The extra overshield and add clearing capabilities will also allow you to allocate different fragments into your builds.
Masterworks: Reload Speed

Swashbuckler is really the only standout perk in the fourth column. Some more niche options exist but there's also not really a big pull to use this year's version of the Title for PvP. Rangefinder does help push out your zoom but with the recent changes to rangefinder it's less than stellar.
Masterworks: Stability

Tigerspite is one of those guns that despite not having the best perks, the best stats, or even the best model; something about it feels phenomenal. I enjoy almost every Tigerspite I use, and I am excited to get more of them. Kinetic Tremors, Frenzy, or Kill Clip will depend on your activity and favorite damage boost. Pair it with your favorite reload or reload bypassing perk and you've got a dependable workhorse auto that just feels like bliss.
Masterworks: Handling

Tigerspite now has a better glow-up for PvP. Fragile Focus is great for starting an engagement but will quickly lose its value the longer you're in a gunfight. Moving Target is neutrally good for providing a better strafe speed and some much needed aim assist. I prefer Kill Clip in the final column to lower my TtK requirements in subsequent kills, but if you're going to take this into Trials or 3v3 game modes, Eye of the Storm might be better for its consistency duel to duel.
Masterworks: Range

I believe of the loot refresh, Tusk of the Boar is probably the most exciting. A strand wave frame grenade launcher? Heck yeah. We can grab ourselves an Envious Assassin and Chain Reaction roll for a "kinetic" Forbearance. If you're looking for Strand synergy, a better combination would be Slice and Hatchling. You can also just go for a full Bait and Switch loadout with a Tusk of the Boar, Forbearance, and Apex Predator! Look at you go, you fully optimized guardian you.
Masterworks: Velocity

In PvP, Tusk of the Boar doesn't have anything incredible that sets it apart from any other grenade launcher and being Strand limits it from the best grenade launcher perk: Disruption Break. Without Disruption Break I don't see any great use outside of more niche Strand builds.
Masterworks: Velocity

Similarly to Retold Tale, Twilight Oath has PvE perks but not the best position. Envious Assassin is great for overfilling the magazine, and Vorpal Weapon will net you great damage. You can utilize the full extent of Precision Instrument, my biggest issue is the frame. Rapid-fire frame snipers are hard to utilize at max RPM and require a hard pull down to keep on target. With the crit box shrinking on some bosses and champions doing what champions want to do, it will be hard to continuously hit crits at max RPM. Otherwise it's a pretty solid general use sniper.
Masterworks: Reload Speed

All of the Dreaming City weapons have a special place in my heart. Twilight Oath is no exception, it was the sniper I mained until Revoker came out. I never used a Snapshot Sights and Opening Shot roll, but I think it would be fun. You're going to need to split your stat investments between handling and range to make sure you can feel that 70 aim assist on those longer sightlines.
Masterworks: Range, Handling

Forbearance, Salvager's Salvo, or Undercurrent. Which is going to reign supreme? Probably Forbearance. But Undercurrent is a decent attempt. Voltshot isn't as significant as Chain Reaction and only works on the first hit of subsequent shots. Bait and Switch is interesting for keeping up damage but not having a reliable magazine overflow perk hurts a bit more. Ambitious Assassin is great, but Envious is better. Overall I'd say it's a neat addition but you wouldn't be too hurt not having it if you already have Forbearance or Salvo.
Masterworks: Velocity

Undercurrent in the crucible is a bit under where we need it to be. Explosive Personality is far better as a primer and other grenade launchers will be better for clean ups. Demolitionist and Adrenaline Junkie have synergy together but aren't the best combination to see.
Masterworks: Velocity

Voltshot isn't as significant as Chain Reaction and only works on the first hit of subsequent shots. Masterworks: Velocity

Uzume RR4 returns to us with some interesting rolls. Fourth Time's the Charm and Vorpal Weapon are going to be your best neutral and solo picks. Golden Tricorn on Solar might be fun for short damage cycles. Precision Instrument is the worst damage perk of the three for me but pairs really well with Fourth Time's the Charm for all the precision hits. Either way you slice it, having a magazine boosting perk is a requirement.
Masterworks: Reload Speed

In PvP things have shifted a bit, Explosive Payload feels like you have a better hitbox, but doesn't actually provide any benefits other than shooting the floor for some splash damage. Vorpal Weapon allows you to one shot any super, which is helpful for Trials rounds or general PvP super fights. Snapshot Sights and as much handling as you can invest will make this sniper feel extremely strong.
Masterworks: Handling

Uzume RR4 returns to us with some interesting rolls. Fourth Time's the Charm and Vorpal Weapon are going to be your best neutral and solo picks. Golden Tricorn on Solar might be fun for short damage cycles. Precision Instrument is the worst damage perk of the three for me but pairs really well with Fourth Time's the Charm for all the precision hits. Either way you slice it, having a magazine boosting perk is a requirement.
Masterworks: Reload Speed

In PvP things have shifted a bit, Explosive Payload feels like you have a better hitbox, but doesn't actually provide any benefits other than shooting the floor for some splash damage. Vorpal Weapon allows you to one shot any super, which is helpful for Trials rounds or general PvP super fights. Snapshot Sights and as much handling as you can invest will make this sniper feel extremely strong.
Masterworks: Handling

I'm happy for more variants of weapons. Vengeful Whisper being a strand bow opens up some loadout flexibility and covers your strand subclass verbs. It's less useful without Match Game but it can still be useful for taking out shields faster. Archer's Tempo is fantastic on bows for lowering successive draw times, and Precision Instrument fits nicely as you'll want to hit those crits, the draw time allowing you a bit of forgiveness lining up those crit shots. You could even switch it up and go with Explosive Payload and Successful Warm-Up if you're using this in lower and PvE where you can one shot everything to keep Successful Warm-Up going.
Masterworks: Draw Time

In the crucible I don't think you'll find as much success. Vengeful Whisper does have Explosive Head for better flinch and AoE but I find bow swapping a bit easier with a handling perk like Shot Swap or even Perpetual Motion. If you're not bow swapping I prefer Archer's Tempo or Rapid Hit for better follow up shots. Successful Warm-Up is great but only works after your first kill.
Masterworks: Draw Time

Vouchsafe returns but has lost a bit of its edge. It used to be a really good void scout, comparable to Night Watch. And while Night Watch has still kept some of its relevance over the years, Doom of Chelchis has overtaken Vouchsafe for the best in slot weapon. Vouchsafe does retain some great perks in Rapid Hit and Explosive Payload, while also adding in great perks like Repulsor Brace and Golden Tricorn. It might not be the ultimate best weapon, but it also doesn't require any raiding.
Masterworks: Stability

Lightweight frames in PvP are in an interesting spot. They don't kill fast enough to be competitive, and any boosts don't really elevate the weapon further. Golden Tricorn 2x does allow you to 3 shot any guardian at any resilience at a 0.60 TtK, but it requires two whole kills to get rolling and without additional ability kills you'll be back at square one before you know it. Taraxippos and Eternal Blazon with Kill Clip or even Tarnished Mettle with Swashbuckler allow you to 3 crit after just one kill.
Masterworks: Stability

Let's talk about power creep. When Waking Vigil released it was a phenomenal arc hand cannon. Outclassed by Nation of Beasts for the best arc hand cannon. With its midlife refresh Waking Vigil was blessed with a reload perk and an AoE perk through Dragonfly. However it was still overshadowed by Nation of Beasts and by then Ancient Gospel. When the hand cannon merger happened, Waking Vigil lost its only claim to fame being a Lightweight hand cannon versus the aforementioned adaptives. While we still have some great perks going on currently, Waking Vigil is just a relic from the past.
Masterworks: Handling

Waking Vigil used to be one of the most coveted energy hand cannons. A slimline model, access to Rangefinder and Opening Shot together to have an energy Dire Promise. Current form is a little less than stellar due to the lack of Slideshot, but it still retains the OG roll if you still care about Rangefinder.
Masterworks: Range

Whisper is back and craftable. What seems to be the best perks for our dear friend Xol, Will of Thousands? Arrowhead Brake is the best in slot for making the recoil direction vertical, but if you don't need that, Corkscrew Rifling or Fluted Barrel for the added stats. Bungie decided against magazine extending perks so the best here is Flared Magwell for when you miss and need to reload. Alloy Mag is great if you do run out of ammo and need to reload before another boss fight or after a wipe. In the third column Field Prep brings up the already buffed reserves while also making reloading faster when crouched. The final column are the stocks and Short-Action Stock is the best for the added handling, if you didn't slot in Arrowhead Brake and still want the recoil direction bumped up you could instead go for Fitted Stock.
Masterworks:

If you wanted to take Whisper into PvP bump up the handling via Fluted Barrel and Short-Action Stock. Field Prep also gives a handling bonus when crouched and Accurized Rounds will also bump up your range.
Masterworks:

I am glad to see more obtainable double-fire grenade launchers. Wilderflight is great, but being locked behind a dungeon means most players won't even see it drop. Being a Vanguard reward allows more players to obtain it, and I love that as the double-fire is a very fun and interesting option within our ever-expanding arsenal. For PvE you're looking for the tried and true Envious Assassin, this paired with Incandescent will clear rooms and deal some great damage against bosses. Unrelenting is a great option if you're committing to using Wild Style as your main weapon, the extra healing plus synergy with Solar verbs will make you unkillable.
Masterworks: Blast Radius

Wild Style and by extension all double-fire grenade launchers have one limiting factor, and that is that it fires two shots at once. If your one grenade bounces away you lose half your damage. With Bungie's architecture it happens more often than not. Disorienting Grenades will allow you to still blind even if one goes away, and High-Velocity Rounds will keep your arc tighter to make bounces less punishing (if you're not purposefully bouncing shots).
Masterworks: Blast Radius

Being a Vanguard reward allows more players to obtain it, and I love that as the double-fire is a very fun and interesting option within our ever-expanding arsenal.
